job_description:
Job Summary:

Provides a broad range of administrative, facilitation, and technical support functions in the area of Quality and Safety Improvement to support Quality and Safety programs and initiatives. Contributes to the development, implementation, monitoring, and continuous improvement of Quality and Safety programs and initiatives. Contributes to the development and monitoring of performance indicators and metrics, collaborates with appropriate departments to collect, analyze, and trend data from multiple reporting systems and sources to identify opportunities to improve quality and safety, decrease risk, and maintain the KP safety culture. Coordinates across workgroups to address priority issues and acts as a resource within established guidelines for issues related to quality and safety. Supports multiple committees that are coordinated or chaired by the department. Contributes to organizations compliance with professional standards, laws and regulations, and internal requirements related to quality and safety.

Essential Responsibilities:

Pursues effective relationships with others by proactively providing resources, information, advice, and expertise with coworkers and members. Listens to, seeks, and addresses performance feedback; provides mentoring to team members. Pursues self-development; creates plans and takes action to capitalize on strengths and develop weaknesses; influences others through technical explanations and examples. Adapts to and learns from change, challenges, and feedback; demonstrates flexibility in approaches to work; helps others adapt to new tasks and processes. Supports and responds to the needs of others to support a business outcome.

Completes work assignments autonomously by applying up-to-date expertise in subject area to generate creative solutions; ensures all procedures and policies are followed; leverages an understanding of data and resources to support projects or initiatives. Collaborates cross-functionally to solve business problems; escalates issues or risks as appropriate; communicates progress and information. Supports, identifies, and monitors priorities, deadlines, and expectations. Identifies, speaks up, and implements ways to address improvement opportunities for team.

Conducts data extraction, analyses, and presentations to support quality improvement efforts by: conducting descriptive and inferential statistics for quality improvement evaluations; creating charts, graphs, and narrative summaries of improvements utilizing multiple data reporting systems; preparing quality improvement metric reports at the individual level to demonstrate improvements and effectiveness of quality improvement programs into specified formats; and identifying and documenting trends, potential errors, and other analysis for further review and reports them to the supervisor.

Supports quality improvement and improvement risk management efforts by: assisting with the development of corrective action plan for areas of improvement identified through utilization review, clinical records audit, claim denials, member satisfaction surveys, and auditing surveys; ensuring process improvements are compliant with established internal and external regulation requirements; conducting root cause analysis, failure mode and effect analysis, and other assessments in response to near misses and good catches in order to identify areas of improvement; and assisting with escalating high-risk issues and trends to appropriate entity for resolutions.

Develops and utilizes quality improvement performance metrics by: implementing and developing performance metrics, standards, and methods to establish improvement success; collaborating with multiple stakeholders, often with competing/conflicting objectives, to ensure development of cohesive and reachable metrics are practical and approved; and facilitating the collection of metric data from workflows and projects by utilizing sound methodology.

Facilitates the development of quality improvement initiatives by: implementing methods and tools to develop stakeholders capabilities for process improvements; applying data-driven improvement principles, tools, and problem-solving methods, including Lean/Six-Sigma concepts and techniques using quality improvement metrics; and developing milestones, detailed workplans, and documentation practices.

Serves as the subject matter expert for quality improvement processes and regulations within assigned area by: learning current internal policies and external regulations; participating on committees, projects to provide guidance on the enforcement, development of policies or procedures of regulations and auditing processes; leveraging collaborative, results oriented partnerships to ensure compliance with regulations and improve patient safety, maintain the KP safety culture, reporting accuracy, and health outcomes; and preparing materials for educational programs to raise awareness for regulation requirement, internal concerns, and system/database usage.

Delivers stakeholder development and quality performance review efforts by: coordinating and conducting utilization and performance reviews utilizing multidisciplinary criteria and guidelines, and takes a systematic approach to quality improvement; identifying performance areas of improvement for stakeholders and provides feedback and coaching as needed; and delivering training and educational programs related to process improvement for quality improvement programs for stakeholders.
Minimum Qualifications:
Minimum one (1) year of experience with databases and spreadsheets or continuous quality improvement (CQI) tools.
Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Health Care Administration, Nursing, Public Health, or related field AND Minimum two (2) years of experience in quality, performance improvement, customer service, or a related field OR Minimum five (5) years of experience in heath care quality assurance/improvement or a directly related field.
Additional Requirements:
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs): Applied Data Analysis; Quality Improvement; Development Planning; Agile Methodologies; Process Mapping; Project Management; Risk Assessment
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience using/creating/redesigning reports using SQL, PowerBI, Tableau, Clarity, and/or MIDAS
A successful track record of leading, training, and mentoring data analytics teams
Two (2) years experience working with business intelligence tools.
Two (2) years experience working with Open Source Tools (e g , R, Python).
Master's degree in Business Administration, Health Care Administration, Nursing, Public Health, or related field.
Certified Professional in Healthcare Quality (CPHQ).
Health care clinical license from the practicing/applicable state (e.g., Registered Nurse (RN), Registered Pharmacist (RPh), Physical Therapist, Occupational Therapist, Speech Therapist, Social Worker).

My experience as a Healthcare Data Analyst at Boston Children’s Hospital has honed my skills in contributing to the development, implementation, and continuous improvement of quality and safety programs, aligning well with the job requirements.

My technical skills and collaborative approach have consistently led to successful outcomes in healthcare settings, making me excited about the potential to contribute meaningfully to your organization's quality and safety endeavors.

Sincerely,  
Benjamin Cooper

job_description:
Hamden Hall Country Day School is accepting applications for a Head Varsity Girls Ice Hockey Coach.

Preferred candidates would have prior playing or coaching experience. This position is for a first year program in the 2024-25 school year. This coaching position is not attached to a teaching position at the school.

Interested candidates should email the Director of Athletics at ddoyle@hamenhall.org with a resume that includes coaching and playing experience.
cover_letter:
Sam Chandler  
September 27, 2024

Dear Mr. Doyle,

I am writing to express my interest in the Head Varsity Girls Ice Hockey Coach position at Hamden Hall Country Day School. With a rich background in athletic fundraising and a passion for team-building and mentorship, I am excited about the opportunity to lead and develop the school's inaugural girls' ice hockey team.

While my professional experience has largely been in roles focusing on sales, client relationships, and team management, my organizational skills and ability to build meaningful connections uniquely position me for this coaching role. My time at Gaucho Fund honed my ability to coordinate events and connect with a diverse range of stakeholders while achieving ambitious fundraising goals. I have translated these skills into effective team leadership and strategic planning skills, which are crucial for launching a first-year program.

As a Social Media Manager at Barstool Sports, I was tasked with creating and managing a new UCSB Barstool Instagram and Twitter account. This experience taught me the importance of nurturing a team culture and motivating my peers, which are foundational elements of any successful sports program. Successfully managing and expanding this team highlights my capability to lead and foster a dynamic and successful unit—skills directly transferable to coaching a varsity team.

In addition to my professional achievements, my academic pursuits, including a Certificate in Sports Management and a Minor in Spanish, reflect my commitment to the field of athletics and my ability to communicate effectively with diverse groups. I am enthusiastic about the prospect of applying my organizational communication skills and strategic planning capabilities to inspire and develop the student-athletes at Hamden Hall Country Day School.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to contribute to the school's athletics department and make a positive impact on the girls’ ice hockey program.

Sincerely,  
Sam Chandler

cover_letter:
Sam Chandler  
September 29, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the position focused on organizing iPhone videos and collaborating with a dynamic team during game events. With a strong background in communication and extensive experience in social media management, I am enthusiastic about the opportunity to contribute to your team and streamline video content processes in real time.

As a former Social Media Manager for Barstool Sports, I successfully established and grew the UCSB Barstool Instagram and Twitter accounts, engaging over 30,100 followers through innovative content strategies and data-driven insights on engagement. This experience honed my ability to communicate effectively with diverse teams and adapt quickly during high-pressure situations, which I believe will be invaluable in supporting iPhone filmers and your social media team during live game events.

My role as an Inside Sales Representative with the New York Yankees further developed my organizational and interpersonal communication skills. Balancing a portfolio of over $300,000, I fostered relationships with clients through personalized interactions, demonstrating the effectiveness of adaptive communication and planning. These skills are crucial for efficiently coordinating video logistics and ensuring smooth operation schedules.

I am particularly drawn to the flexible work schedule associated with this role, as it aligns with my experience working during unpredictable game events and my commitment to delivering high-quality results under varying conditions. I am confident that my background and dedication to strategic communication and organization will greatly benefit your team and help elevate the quality and reach of your video content.

Sincerely,  
Sam Chandler

job_description:
Digital Content Assistant (Part-Time)
Overtime - Part Time
CA · Remote
Web/Creative Services: Media/Video Production
3
+
months ago
Share
Overtime is searching for a part-time Digital Content Assistant to assist with the organization of footage. This is a remote opportunity and the needs can range from 15-25 hours per week on average.

What you’ll do
Organize iPhone videos in live time on in-house app
Communicate with iPhone filmers & social media team during game events
Work hours tentative based on game events
Ability to work with a flexible schedule

Who you are
Knowledge of basketball & football (preferably high school athletes)
Excellent communication skills
Social Media Savvy- Understanding of content published on social media platforms (bonus if familiar with Overtime specific content)
Eagerness to learn in house tech apps
Reliable and available to work off hours and weekends
Emphasis on organization and attention to detail
cover_letter:
Sam Chandler  
September 29, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Part-Time Digital Content Assistant position at Overtime. With my background in social media management and communication, combined with a passion for sports, I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to Overtime's mission by managing and organizing dynamic digital content.

My experience as a Social Media Manager at Barstool Sports, where I established and grew the UCSB Barstool Instagram and Twitter accounts to over 30,000 followers, demonstrates my ability to engage audiences through strategic social media content. This role honed my organizational skills and my aptitude for analyzing engagement metrics, making me adept at optimizing content for maximum reach and impact. Understanding the nuances of social media content, particularly ones that resonate with sports enthusiasts, directly aligns with Overtime’s focus.

In addition to my social media experience, working with the New York Yankees as an Inside Sales Representative enhanced my communication abilities, skillfully balancing client interactions, and meetings with diverse stakeholders. My familiarity with sports, particularly basketball and football, through both personal interest and professional exposure, ensures a swift adaptation to Overtime’s platform. I am deeply interested in the opportunity to contribute to and learn within a forward-thinking media production team with flexibility in scheduling.

I am eager to bring my enthusiasm for sports and proficiency in digital content management to the talented team at Overtime. Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the possibility of contributing to Overtime’s digital initiatives.

Sincerely,  
Sam Chandler

focus_areas: Python, Tableau and other Business Intelligence tools, SQL, Lean Six Sigma Methodologies
job_description:
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility

At UCLA Health, our advanced information technology plays a critical role in elevating our overall patient care and delivering positive patient experiences. Your passion and specialized expertise will help us enhance our award-winning technological capabilities. Join us and experience a career of unmatched challenges and profound rewards.

 

You will provide advanced data and analytical support to UCLA Health System. Your responsibilities will include:

 

Development and management of databases that support efficient workflow and adhere to the specifications of regulatory agencies
Provides data support to data-driven performance improvement projects within UCLA Health system.
Prepare reports and Tableau dashboards and presents findings to health system leaders and teams.
Manage data-driven projects and assists with the identification of critical issues and development of solutions using the PDCA and Lean methodologies.
Work effectively with minimum supervision as part of a team and work productively with the department staff while assuring the maximum use of technology to promote efficient work systems
 

At UCLA Health, our passion for leveraging state-of-the-art technology to support world-class patient care has enabled us to become an internationally renowned health system with four award-winning hospitals and more than 270 community clinics throughout Southern California. We’re also home to the world-class medical research and clinical education capabilities of the David Geffen School of Medicine. If you’re looking to experience greater challenge and fulfillment in your career, come to UCLA Health.

 

Schedule: Monday - Friday; 8:00am - 5:00pm (Flexible Hybrid)

Annual Salary Range: $83,800.00 - $179,400.00

Job Qualifications
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility

REQUIRED:

BS degree in statistics, Business, computer science, mathematics, or quantitative analysis related field or equivalent experience
Advance skill in Python, Tableau, SQL, R, Excel, SPSS, and PowerPoint
Have 2+ experience in Clinical Data Analytics, Statistics, and Quality Measures
Have 3+ experience in advance analytical and quantitative skills
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Project management skills                                      
Excellent understanding of the industry-specific issues, regulatory requirements, and current healthcare industry
Must have the ability to work in a fast-paced and creative environment
Ability to think “outside-the-box” and be creative to accomplish departmental goals
Ability to prioritize work and remain detail oriented
Ability to lead System wide complex projects
Excellent oral and written communication skills
cover_letter:
Benjamin Cooper  
September 29, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Data Analyst position at UCLA Health. With a robust background in healthcare data analytics, advanced proficiency in Python, Tableau, and SQL, coupled with my ongoing Master of Science in Data Science in Biomedicine from UCLA, I am eager to contribute to your esteemed organization in elevating patient care through data-driven insights.  

During my role as a Healthcare Data Analyst at Boston Children’s Hospital, I perfected my skills in crafting impactful data visualizations and facilitating data-driven decision-making across hospital departments. I played a pivotal role in leveraging data analytics for quality improvement projects, including my contribution to the US News & World Report Pediatric Hospital Survey submission, which involved creating comprehensive Tableau dashboards and presenting critical findings to institutional leaders. This experience has honed my ability to lead complex projects, make data actionable, and effectively collaborate with diverse teams, perfectly aligning with the requirements at UCLA Health.  

My expertise in Lean Six Sigma methodologies equips me with the tools to manage data-driven projects efficiently and drive performance improvement initiatives. I have led projects utilizing PDCA cycles to identify and solve critical issues within healthcare environments, focusing on increasing efficiency and regulatory compliance. At Cipher Skin, I developed sophisticated algorithms for medical applications, proving my adeptness at marrying statistical acumen with practical healthcare challenges to enhance patient care solutions.  

UCLA Health's mission of leveraging state-of-the-art technology to advance patient care deeply resonates with me. My combination of technical skills, coupled with my passion for applying data science to improve healthcare outcomes, makes me an ideal candidate to drive innovative solutions in your team. I look forward to the possibility of contributing to UCLA Health's legacy of excellence and innovation.  

Sincerely,  
Benjamin Cooper

focus_areas: Data Analysis Skills,
job_description:
SUMMARY

LAC-DHS Women’s Health Programs and Innovation (WHPI) is seeking a skilled Assistant Staff Analyst to work withing WHPI’s Data team with a range of program research planning and implementation, and evaluation activities including but not limited to administration of study development, study compliance, monitoring, data management and analysis, reporting, and publication. Evaluation support is needed for WHPI’s grant programs conglomerate (medical maternal home care, home visitation, extended postpartum care for families), and auxiliary women’s health-related studies.

The Assistant Staff Analyst has experience in the development and coordination of program interventions for at-risk or high-risk populations designed to reduce poor outcomes through medical, mental, educational, and/or psychosocial supports. A successful history of collaboratively organizing and managing large, multi-faceted data projects; accommodating pivots in data needs and analyses; and anticipating auxiliary data requests is essential.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Adheres to HIPAA privacy, confidentiality and cybersecurity standards and practices, in all areas of service delivery, including evaluation activities.
Maintains confidentiality of all patient-related files and protected health information.
Planning, Development, and Implementation – create and maintain state, local, and departmental Institutional Review Board submissions (new projects, addenda, and waivers), renewals, adverse reaction incidents, and progress reports; develop/select appropriate data sharing agreements between institutions; enforce HIPAA in data sharing, storage, and security.
Data Management – export and abstract data from Cerner system and any supplemental software (ChallengerSoft, SurveyMonkey, RedCap); develop and monitor data collection protocol; clean and store data per quality assurance guidelines.
Data analysis – use Excel and/or a statistical software package or environment (SAS, SPSS) to conduct basic, preliminary quantitative analyses (chi-square, t-test); assist with qualitative analyses (document review, interviews, non-participatory observation) manually or with software aid; develop data analysis quality assurance practices.
Research and evaluation – create preliminary logic model or theory of change; develop/select culturally competent methods and measures; form data analysis plan; assess data feasibility; conduct power analysis to establish sample size; construct measures; draft literature reviews, where needed.
Verbal and written Communication and reporting – communicate clearly, professionally, and effectively with fellow staff. Participate in team building efforts to promote positive interpersonal relationships with team members.
Maintain internal and external documentation, data dashboards and illustrations; conduct oral presentations for varied audience levels (lay persons, program staff, medical staff, academic readers)
Professional writing – prepare conference abstracts, journal articles, conference posters, briefings, website content, and instructional materials as requested.
Collaboration – participate in (and occasionally lead) inter-unit and intra-departmental meetings to collaborate on initiatives, studies, evaluations, projects. Participate in team building efforts to promote positive interpersonal relationships with the team, collaborator members.
Attend relevant training as necessary to expand professionally and increase knowledge in maternal and infant health to successfully perform in the role.
May complete special projects specific to the function of the department.
Demonstrate and maintain flexibility with shifting priorities and assignments.
Other duties as assigned within the scope of position expectations.
SELECTION REQUIREMENTS

A Master's Degree from an accredited college or university in a discipline such as Public Health, Environmental Health, Community Health Education, Behavioral Sciences, or Social Sciences, with coursework related to the essential job functions of the position.

ONLINE APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS

At a minimum, candidates need to submit/upload electronic copies of a resume describing education to include training certifications, and relevant paid and volunteer experience – relevant to the job description essential job functions. Applications need to include legible copies of education diplomas/transcripts as applicable, and driver’s license.

A cover introductory letter to describe relevant skills, knowledge and abilities may be submitted, while not required.

Legible copies of certificates to substantiate proficiency in skills, knowledge and abilities may be submitted.

Applications without supporting documentation at the time of application or no more than 15 days after the initial application will not be included in the candidate pool.

Review of job description at https://helunahealth.org/join-our-team/ is suggested, especially if applying to the position from a third-party online application.
cover_letter:
Benjamin Cooper  
September 29, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my enthusiastic interest in the Assistant Staff Analyst position at LAC-DHS Women’s Health Programs and Innovation (WHPI). With a strong foundation in data science and a specialization in healthcare data analysis, I am eager to bring my expertise in algorithm development, predictive modeling, and data management to WHPI’s Data Team. My educational background and professional experience align with the qualifications you are seeking, and I am confident in my ability to contribute to the research and evaluation activities within your organization.

Throughout my career, I have demonstrated a proven track record in executing complex data projects and driving data-driven decision-making. In my current role as a Healthcare Data Analyst at Boston Children’s Hospital, I am responsible for crafting reports and visualizations that inform hospital-wide initiatives and address health disparities. My ability to lead major data analysis projects, such as the US News & World Report Pediatric Hospital Survey submission, showcases my capacity to tackle significant challenges and deliver results in a healthcare setting.

My educational journey, including a B.S. in Bioengineering and an ongoing M.S. in Data Science in Biomedicine, has equipped me with the technical skills necessary for this role. My expertise in statistical software, such as SAS and SPSS, as well as my proficiency in Python and SQL, enable me to conduct comprehensive quantitative analyses and manage data effectively. I am adept at collaborating with cross-functional teams and creating culturally competent methodologies, ensuring the success of diverse program interventions.

Additionally, my experience in developing and submitting grant proposals, as evidenced by my work with Cipher Skin and other agencies like NIH and DoD, complements WHPI’s focus on grant programs and auxiliary studies. I am passionate about promoting maternal and infant health and look forward to integrating my skills in data visualization, quality improvement, and professional writing to advance WHPI’s mission and initiatives.

Thank you for considering my application. I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to LAC-DHS Women’s Health Programs and Innovation and look forward to the possibility of discussing my candidacy further.

Sincerely,  
Benjamin Cooper

focus_areas: Experience with working with Healthcare Financial Data
job_description:
Full job description
Healthcare Financial Analyst I

Job Category: Accounting/Finance
Department: Finance Services
Location: Los Angeles, CA, US, 90017
Position Type: Full Time
Requisition ID: 11619
Salary Range: $67,186.00 (Min.) - $87,342.00 (Mid.) - $107,498.00 (Max.)

Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation’s largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.

Mission: L.A. Care’s mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.
Job Summary
The Healthcare Financial Analyst I will assist with gathering medical cost data to support the production of internal routine healthcare reports, ad hoc studies, as well as regulatory request required by Department of Health Care Services (DHCS) such as Rate Development Template, Supplemental Data Request, Audit Request. Support of all Actuarial functions and needs. Create and maintain Excel workbook to compare monthly, quarterly, and yearly membership, medical cost and utilization data, Identify and track data anomalies. This position will work closely with Financial Analyst II and III to provide assistance and perform routine task.
Duties
Support in gathering data to feed regulatory request required by Department of Health Care Services (DHCS) such as Rate Development Template, Supplemental Data Request, Audit Request. Accurately and timely completion of regulatory data request.
Updating ad hoc and routine monthly/quarterly/yearly reports, identify and research variance.
Update integrated revenue/medical care expense (FFS + RX Claims/Provider Capitation/other medical cost) analysis. Update financial reconciliation and data validation workbooks,
Generate reports from accounting system and convert to useable format.
Supports higher level financial analyst with audits and projects.
Meets deadlines with accurate data and support the legal department's arguments.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Duties Continued
Education Required
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration
In lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered.
Education Preferred
Bachelor's Degree
Experience
Required:
At least 2 years of finance or managed healthcare experience.
Skills
Required:
Understanding of financial/accounting concepts.
Basic knowledge of SQL programming. Demonstrated knowledge in data analysis, MS Excel and SQL programming.
Must be able to create and manage Excel spreadsheets.
Must have solid and effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Must have strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Preferred:
Understanding of health care cost structures (fee schedules, health care cost categories, and health care service utilizations, and medical codes).
Medical/Medicare/Commercial Health Insurance knowledge.
Licenses/Certifications Required
Licenses/Certifications Preferred
Required Training
Physical Requirements
Light

Benjamin Cooper  
September 29, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Healthcare Financial Analyst I position at L.A. Care Health Plan. With a diverse background in data science and healthcare analytics, coupled with a passion for supporting underserved communities, I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to L.A. Care’s mission of providing quality healthcare access within Los Angeles County.

My professional experience has equipped me with a robust understanding of healthcare financial data. As a Healthcare Data Analyst at Boston Children’s Hospital, I led initiatives that bolstered data-driven decision-making and successfully facilitated the hospital's state-run Medicaid program, capturing significant financial benefits. This experience has given me deep insights into the complexities of medical cost data analysis and the capabilities necessary to meet regulatory and audit requirements.

I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Bioengineering from Syracuse University and am currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Data Science in Biomedicine from UCLA. My education, combined with skills in SQL and advanced data visualization using tools like Python and AWS, has honed my ability to create and manage sophisticated Excel workbooks and reports. These skills are pivotal for identifying and tracking data anomalies and supporting various actuarial functions, as outlined in the job description.

In each of my roles, I have demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills, underpinned by effective communication and collaboration with cross-functional teams. My work at Cipher Skin as a Data Scientist involved developing predictive models and algorithms for healthcare technology, which speaks to my capability in handling complex datasets and extracting actionable insights.

I am eager to bring my expertise in healthcare financial data and my commitment to community health to L.A. Care Health Plan. I am confident that my background and skills align well with the requirements of the Healthcare Financial Analyst I role, and I look forward to the opportunity to contribute to such a commendable organization.

Sincerely,  
Benjamin Cooper

focus_areas: Experience with Healthcare Data, Python, SQL, AWS, Jupyter
job_description:
Wellth is a fast growing digital health company based in Los Angeles with team members across the U.S. The company is backed by leading investors including SignalFire and others, with notable advisors and recent key hires building out the leadership team. For details, check out our team page. 

Wellth motivates people to prioritize their health, every day. Built on the science of behavioral economics, Wellth’s platform creates lasting behavior change and positive health outcomes by motivating hard-to-reach members to follow through on healthy behaviors daily. Wellth's mobile app enables members to easily document their daily healthy behaviors and earn rewards that in turn close care gaps, improve quality measures, and reduce costs. Thousands of people have checked in over 25 million times resulting in previously unachievable outcomes for customers and our members. 

Learn more by visiting wellthapp.com.

You will have the opportunity to solve interesting healthcare data problems. 
Specifically, you will:

Perform data analysis to propose target patient cohorts.
Develop visualizations that persuade potential customers of Wellth program ROI.
Partner with customer data teams to ensure successful data ingestion and accurate ROI analyses.
Create and validate transformations from customer formats to standard Wellth format.
Perform internal analyses to assist product and operations teams.
Assist with Quarterly Business Review report generation.
Work closely with the internal data analysis and engineering team on recommendations for improving infrastructure, pipelines, security, and operations.
You will be a member of a diverse and supportive team. 
You will work with:

Sales and Customer Success leaders on supporting pre-sale, post-sale, quarterly, and ongoing customer engagements.
Product leaders on cohort patient selection and product marketing initiatives.
Data engineers on establishing standard operating procedures for data operations and gathering customer data requirements for bespoke solutions.
Senior leaders to assist with their customer acquisition and retention strategies.
Our Manager of Data Engineering on your career development, supporting your technical and leadership growth.
You might be the candidate we’re looking for.
We’re looking for someone who has:

3+ years of experience working with healthcare products and data, having directly worked with claims data, patient data, and other health-related data sets.
3+ years of professional experience as a healthcare data analyst or healthcare data engineer.
Proficiency in writing clean and maintainable SQL, Python, and shell scripts for automation, analysis, and ETL using industry best practices.
Proficiency in executing and maintaining dbt tools.
Proficiency in analyzing and using database schemas and data dictionaries.
Knowledge of Redshift, BigQuery, and other data warehouse infrastructure.
Excellent verbal and written communication in customer, internal, and leadership contexts.
High comfort level in operating with autonomy, delivering independently and in a team environment.
Understanding of business processes, ROI, cost analyses, and financial modeling.
We expect our candidates can:

Thrive on the freedom and responsibility of working at a growing startup.
Take ownership of and manage customer data projects and onboarding from start to finish and collaborate well with cross-functional roles.
Be a subject matter expert on data interchange with our customers while maintaining attention to detail.
Be a part of the solution that is helping to fix all aspects of healthcare from provider to payer to, most importantly, the person seeking care.
Participate in data storytelling by assembling a compelling story through data analysis and data quality investigations. 
In addition to the above, our ideal candidate has:

Experience working with Jupyter, Spark, and other data research technologies.
Experience working with Apache Airflow, Glue, Fivetran, and other data orchestration technologies.
Experience working with Great Expectations, Metaplane, and other data quality technologies.
Deep knowledge of data security to protect highly confidential and sensitive data, especially in the healthcare industry.

job_description:
• 1 year sales or customer service experience preferred
• High School Diploma or equivalent
What you'll be doing day to day
• Build loyalty by ensuring customers have a positive final touchpoint during the IKEA shopping experience
• Provides an efficient and accurate checkout experience in various areas of the store
• Offers additional products and services such as home delivery, credit card, and IKEA Family card
• Resolves customer concerns independently to meet their unique needs and expectations
• Provides friendly, safe, and efficient car loading and unloading services
Together as a Team
At IKEA it’s all about our customers, and in Customer Relations we build and retain long-lasting relationships with new and existing customers in a multichannel retail environment. We’re a diverse team that work together to ensure a positive and joyful experience for all IKEA visitors and customers: we set up services, gather feedback and make things right! Our modus operandi is to connect to people by listening to their personal needs and to create genuine interactions. We’re a bunch of people who are truly passionate about people!
QUALIFICATIONS
• 1 year sales or customer service experience preferred
• High School Diploma or equivalent
Apply now!
The hourly pay range for this role is $17.15
JOB TYPE – Permanent, Full-time
BENEFITS ELIGIBLE? Yes
HOURS –34 -40 hours per week. Open weekend availability. Shifts scheduled from 9 am to 9 pm.

job_description:
About the job
Empassion is one of the most impactful and exciting start ups in health care. We are focused on improving the experience and lowering costs for seniors at end of life. Specifically, we provide palliative and hospice care for seniors with serious illness and high risk of an over-medicalized death. This population is highly neglected in the current market. Empassion clients are payers and risk-bearing entities and we work with community palliative and hospice partners to deliver superior outcomes. We are live today across 44 states and growing rapidly. Empassion is a hybrid remote/in-person company, with headquarters in NYC. We prioritize asynchronous work and communication but are quick to get on a call, Zoom, or even flight if the situation requires higher fidelity discussion. You will have the opportunity to spend time with colleagues in person, including an all-team offsite 1-2x per year (location varies). What your experience will be: The Data & Analytics team is a high-impact, high-visibility team that works cross-functionally with the entire organization. We are creating a robust, flexible, and modern analytics platform that is core to delivering the company’s technology and service capabilities. The Data Analyst will report directly to the Director of Data & Analytics. They will work alongside a team of experienced Analytics Engineers and Data Analysts to build out and maintain robust data pipelines and analytics solutions to better understand our patient population using a combination of SQL, dbt, and Looker. They will partner closely with our Growth, Product-Dev, Ops, and Finance teams to deliver explanatory and actionable insights as we work to improve the care our patients receive. Why you belong here and how you will grow: This is a remote opportunity to support the buildout of Empassion’s analytics platform and to be part of a passionate, skilled, and committed team working together to realize our shared vision. We pride ourselves on providing accurate, timely, and actionable data to our internal and external users. We hold ourselves to a high standard that respects the impact our data and analytics can have on a patient’s course of care. The Data & Analytics team is composed of specialists who can flex across different types of work as needed. The Data Analyst will be designing and building analytics models, reports, and dashboards to enable and empower Empassion and our customers to better understand their patients. We strive to build sustainable data products that our users can operate themselves day-to-day, but are highly responsive when the business has additional data needs and questions. We are a remote first company, fully distributed across the United States, with a hybrid in-person option for those based in NYC, meeting 2x per week. We prioritize our work activities weekly and hold ourselves accountable to deliverables. We use Slack as a team and have regular Zoom touch points. We have full team offsites 2x per year and additional travel as needed (both to improve work productivity and build team trust). We are dedicated to cultivating relationships built for trust and meaningful experiences that promote your growth. We recognize the value of autonomy, flexibility, and ownership while not losing sight of the importance of real-life experiences. We do not accept anything less than respectful, supportive, and growth-oriented teammates. What success looks like

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and report on data from a variety sources, ensuring data quality, consistency, and accuracy
Calculate novel metrics from our proprietary application and third party platform’s data to understand how patients are moving through care programs and the quality of care they’re receiving from their providers
Design, develop, and maintain algorithms and data models, using SQL and dbt
Use Looker to create visually appealing and informative dashboards and reports to communicate data insights and enable data-driven decision-making by our stakeholders
Create documentation and training materials for technical and non-technical users of our data products
Work with your fellow data analysts and analytics engineers to co-author a coherent and intuitive data warehouse, providing feedback on approaches, code review, and a sense of shared ownership
Expect your 'building time' to be roughly evenly split between dbt, LookML, Looker dashboards, and SQL analysis
Travel up to 15% of the time to collaborate with others in NYC and Jacksonville, Florida


What you will bring

1 to 5 years of experience in data analytics or analytics engineering, having delivered actionable insights and compelling visualizations to Operations, Finance, or Clinical teams
Strong SQL skills
Excellent communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences (peers, engineers, operations, external customers or prospects)
Excitement about working in a fast-moving startup environment
A bias for action and enthusiasm for fast iteration and creative problem solving
A desire to learn more about the operational workflows of our business and the healthcare delivery system as a whole


Nice to have

Familiarity with the basics of healthcare delivery and data sources/standards (Claims, ADT, etc.)
Experience working with Product-Dev teams to thoroughly understand data generated by internally-built applications
Experience with version control using git / github
Experience in dbt and looker
Experience in seed or series A startups

job_description:
About the job
As the Enterprise Data Analyst, you will be an integral part of our data team, providing insights that drive customer success and business growth. This role involves analyzing data, developing dashboards and collaborating with various teams to translate data into actionable insights. If you have a passion for data, enjoy solving problems and are looking to grow your skills in a dynamic healthcare technology environment, this role is for you.

Responsibilities

Partner with customer success, product and clinical teams to support Vida Health’s growth with new and existing customers
Define metrics, analyze trends and create visualizations to communicate health outcomes and drive cost efficiency
Develop dashboards, reports and documentation to help teams make data-driven decisions
Meet with customers to support the launch and ongoing use of data and reporting products like business reviews, data exchange and performance reporting
Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and clinical researchers to ensure data quality and analytical rigor
Participate in cross-functional initiatives that impact both business strategy and the technology roadmap
Manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders to deliver impactful data products

Qualifications

At least 1-2 years of experience in a data analytics role or similar field
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, or related)
Proficiency with SQL and familiarity with Python or R.- ability to write clean, maintainable code for data analysis
Strong critical thinking skills, with the ability to connect the dots across different business areas to enhance Vida’s value
Experience creating compelling data visualizations to tell stories and influence decisions
Ability to work with both technical and non-technical teams, communicating effectively with a range of stakeholders
A proactive, customer-focused mindset, with experience managing projects and delivering high-quality results
Interest in learning new platforms, tools and innovations in data analytics
Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment

Bonus Skills

Experience in a startup or fast-growing company
Healthcare experience
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform, Looker, dbt, or other business intelligence tools

job_description:
About Visana Health
Visana Health is the world's most comprehensive virtual women's health clinic, providing longitudinal medical care and integrated whole person support for every phase of a woman's life. While other women's health companies focus on fertility and maternity, Visana is the only company focused on providing longitudinal, value-based care from menstruation to menopause, including preventive care, urgent care, and complex gynecology care.

We’ve built a best-in-class care model that dramatically improves patient outcomes and experience while reducing costs. We're rapidly becoming the clinic of choice for leading health plans & self-funded employers, including national health plans and Fortune 200 companies, and recently raised a round of capital from world-class healthtech investors.

We've built a team of employees and clinicians passionate about women's health and dedicated to revolutionizing women's healthcare. If this mission resonates, we'd love to hear from you. www.visanahealth.com.

 

About The Job
We are looking for a contract to hire Data Analyst to join our technology team to help analyze and provide quick insights needed to meet key business objectives, and to help drive data-driven decision making across our organization. This role will work cross-functionally to support Business Operations, Clinical Operations, Product and Marketing. In addition to cross-functional stakeholders, you will be an integrated part of our technology team of Engineers, and current Sr. Data Analyst.

In this role, you will pull and analyze data from multiple data sources in Snowflake and Athena EMR and work with our current data analyst to build dashboards in Lightdash (A Looker alternative). You will work with key stakeholders to understand their various data needs. You will enjoy telling stories with data, while keeping data integrity best practices at top of mind. A background in analyzing complex clinical/healthcare data is a plus.

What You Will Do
Work closely with cross-functional team members to plan and execute high-visibility reporting needs while ensuring excellence in data quality

Clean and transform raw data for reporting and analysis

Design and maintain Lightdash dashboards for both internal and external reporting needs

Conduct analysis for quarterly reports for various external clients

Conduct ad-hoc analyses for various cross-functional efforts to drive data driven decision making

Execute client return data files

Clearly present findings to both technical and non-technical team members

Participate in technology team stand-ups, refinements and data model code reviews

Location
●       Remote

What You’ll Need
Qualifications
Experience:

1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst

Bachelors in STEM or other quantitative fields (Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Finance etc.)

Experience working with healthcare data, AthenaOne or Athena Data View is a plus

Skills and Abilities:

Intermediate SQL skills with professional experience working with complex production data

Proficient in Excel

Python or other programming language is a plus but not required

Knowledge of various statistical methods for analyzing data

Experience working with BI tools, such as Looker or Lightdash

Experience working with data warehouses, such as Snowflake

Experience working with dbt (Data Build Tool) is a plus but not required

Excellent communication skills

Strong attention to detail

Familiarity with key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics specific to business operations, such as revenue, cost optimization and productivity and efficiency

Ability to break down complex problems and offer creative data-driven solutions with focus on optimization and scalability

Willingness to jump into a fast-paced startup environment and manage multiple tasks efficiency

job_description:
Associate Data Scientist (Remote, US)
at House Rx (View all jobs)
About us
House Rx is on a mission to make specialty medications more affordable and accessible for patients suffering from chronic illnesses like cancer and autoimmune disorders. We provide clinics with specialized technology and support from pharmacists and care coordinators to dispense medication directly to their patients, known as medically integrated dispensing (MID). We are expanding our product team to help fuel our next phase of growth — keep reading to learn more about the role, our team, and why House Rx is the right next step in your career!

About the role
We are seeking a passionate data scientist to join our data product team. In this role, you will conduct analysis and use good data storytelling to inform our business operations and the care that we deliver to the patients. This work will directly contribute to making specialty medications affordable and accessible for patients. Applicants must be based in the United States.

Key Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with Product and Clinical Operations and use data to prioritize various business initiatives
Have a nose for value and can grasp the problems of a non-technical stakeholder
Establish clear and measurable success metrics, and write queries to measure the effectiveness of data-driven interventions
Conduct analysis on pharmacy data to monitor program performance and uncover interesting trends and patterns
Create clear and compelling visualizations to communicate findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Have the opportunity to grow into a data scientist role and expand responsibilities into predictive modeling and setting up ETL data infrastructure in dbt
Salary Range:  $90,000 - $110,000
This range represents the low and high end of the anticipated base salary/wage. The actual base salary/wage will depend on several factors, including experience, knowledge, and skills. Actual compensation packages may include other elements equity, paid time off and benefits.
About you
You have 3+ years of experience working in a data analytics, data science, data engineering, or a similar role
You have strong SQL and data modeling skills (CTEs, window functions, optimization)
You are proficient in at least one programming language, such as python
You have experience with a major BI tool (e.g. Tableau, Power BI). We use Apache Superset internally
You are an excellent communicator and can work with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization
Why You Should Join Our Team

A career at House Rx offers the chance to work with a talented group of entrepreneurs, healthcare professionals, and technology builders who are passionate about improving specialty care and making it easier for patients to access the medication that they need.  

At House Rx, we strive to build and maintain an environment where employees from all backgrounds are valued, respected and have the opportunity to succeed. You'll find a culture that supports open communication, embracing failure as a learning opportunity, and always being open to new ideas—no matter how radical. We are a remote-first company, however, some pharmacy operations roles require onsite clinic presence. We’re committed to creating a positive and collaborative culture to achieve our mission, all while supporting our team members in all aspects of their lives—at home, at work and everywhere in between.

In particular, we offer:

Flexible work hours and flexible paid time off
Work remotely
Generous parental leave
Comprehensive healthcare, vision and dental benefits
Competitive salary and equity stake
We’re backed by forward-thinking investors committed to transforming healthcare, including Bessemer Venture Partners, First Round Capital, LRV Health, Khosla Ventures, Maverick Ventures, 1984.vc, and Character

focus_areas: Facility Managment
job_description:
Manages tennis facility in addition to servicing facility users. Acts as a main point of contact for all activities in the tennis center including open recreational hours, varsity matches and tournaments, and rentals. Complete oversight of tennis match/tournament management; managing casual wage employees and student staff. Lead liaison for athletics facilities for the Yale Bowl Complex in addition to the tennis center. Coordinates with Yale facilities and users on service requests, vendors, and general facilities improvements/maintenance. Manages the electronic membership system in conjunction with the POS company to adapt programming to organizational needs.

Essential Duties

1. Plans and manages the scheduling, logistics, and operations of all events and programs for the facilities. 2. Responsible for the management of special event and facility rentals. 3. Serves as the Facilities Event Manager for all large rental events and assigned intercollegiate events. 4. Estimates budget requirements for assigned areas. 5. Plans and schedules all maintenance and repair work for assigned facilities. 6. Coordinates the use of assigned athletic facilities for summer camps. 7. Develops and implements facility policies regarding safety, security, liability, maintenance, ADA, budget, and personnel.

Required Education and Experience

Bachelor's degree in a related field and three years of related experience or equivalent combination of education and demonstrated experience.

Required Skill/Ability 1:

Effective written and oral communication skills.

Required Skill/Ability 2:

Proficient in computer operation and Microsoft Office and Excel. Ability to learn membership program.

Required Skill/Ability 3:

Ability to coordinate set-up and breakdown equipment for matches, tournaments and events.

Required Skill/Ability 4:

General understanding of tennis rules and match operation.
cover_letter:
Sam Chandler  
October 06, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Tennis Facility Manager position at Yale University. With a Bachelor of Arts in Communication and a Certificate in Sports Management from the University of California, Santa Barbara, complemented by experience in roles requiring strong leadership, organizational, and interpersonal communication skills, I am well-prepared to contribute meaningfully to the management of Yale’s tennis facilities.

In my previous role as an Inside Sales Representative with the New York Yankees, I not only honed my ability to manage client relations but also developed skills in coordinating logistics and operations to ensure smooth execution of events. This experience directly aligns with the responsibilities of planning and managing schedules, logistics, and operations for all events and programs at the tennis facilities, as described in the job posting. My ability to generate $150,000 in new business while managing a substantial portfolio bears testament to my strong organizational and multitasking capabilities, critical for effective facility management.

Throughout my career, I have demonstrated a meticulous attention to detail and problem-solving skills, particularly in coordinating complex events. This experience has equipped me with the necessary skills to efficiently manage special events and rentals, estimate budget requirements, and ensure all logistical and operational details align with the organization's goals. My proficiency in Microsoft Office and my willingness to learn and operate electronic membership systems highlight my capacity to adapt to the technical demands of the role.

Moreover, my hands-on management experience from my tenure as a Graduate Manager at Pareto involved recruiting top talent and leading evaluation processes—skills that translate seamlessly into managing and inspiring casual wage employees and student staff at Yale. Additionally, my ability to communicate effectively, learned from various roles, will ensure clear and consistent communication with vendors, users, and the Yale facilities team.

I am enthusiastic about the opportunity to contribute to Yale University as a manager who can ensure high standards of service and operational excellence at the tennis center. Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the possibility of discussing how my background, skills, and enthusiasms align with the needs of your team.

Sincerely,  
Sam Chandler

focus_areas: Physical Therapy
job_description: treating patients
cover_letter:
BRAD A COOPER  
October 11, 2024  
  
Dear Hiring Manager,  
  
I am writing to express my enthusiasm for the physical therapy position, where I can bring over three decades of dedicated experience in treating patients, as well as my passion for delivering high-quality care. My professional journey, which spans roles in outpatient clinics, home care, and rehabilitation services, has equipped me with diverse treatment approaches and a deep understanding of patient needs.  
  
With a career that began at renowned institutions like JFK Medical Center and evolved through leadership roles such as President at Cooper Rehabilitation and Sports Therapy, I have honed my skills in developing personalized treatment plans. At Cooper Rehabilitation, I successfully integrated cutting-edge therapeutic techniques, greatly enhancing patient outcomes and business growth. My commitment to excellence in rehabilitation therapy was further solidified through my tenure as a Home Care Therapist with several organizations, where I provided compassionate, one-on-one care.  
  
I am particularly drawn to opportunities that allow for a patient-centered approach, as evident in the collaborative and multidisciplinary settings I've thrived in. My role as a Clinical Consultant for Exerscience, Inc. enriched my ability to understand both the technical and educational aspects of physical therapy, making me adept at teaching patients about their own health journeys. Coupled with active membership and leadership in professional associations, such as the American Physical Therapy Association, I ensure that my practice is informed by the latest advancements and ethical standards.  
  
Joining your team would be a privilege, allowing me to contribute my broad expertise and a genuine passion for patient care. I am eager to bring my skills and dedication to the role, fostering a healing environment where patients feel supported and motivated.  
  
Sincerely,  
BRAD A COOPER

focus_areas: customer service
job_description:
The Study at Yale is currently seeking a Valet Attendant to provide genuine hospitality and the highest quality of service to our guests. The Valet Attendant acts as a representative of the hotel by providing the highest quality of service to our guests under the direction of the Guest Service Manager and in alignment with Study brand standards.

Our caring and attentive associates reinforce our principal belief that guest service is our highest priority. We have opportunities for energetic, service-oriented individuals who are experienced in providing efficient service and memorable experiences.

Responsibilities

Load/unload luggage from car to luggage carts.
Retrieve and park cars courteously, timely and safely.
Proactively approach, greet and acknowledge all guests in a friendly and professional manner.
Courteously open front door for guests.
Be able to quickly run back to station and prepare for next guest’s arrival.
Ability to operate automatic and manual transmissions.
Ensure all cars are ticketed.
Attend to the parking booth to ensure the security of guests' vehicle keys.
Observe assigned areas for any safety hazards or unauthorized tampering with or pilferage to parked vehicles.
Reports immediately any incidents or conditions to the supervisor or Security department.
Maintain accurate record keeping of daily activities.
Escort guests to hotel rooms.
Provide an overview of guest room, hotel services and amenities.
Make deliveries to guest rooms and assist guest with room changes.
Ensure overall guest satisfaction.
Perform other duties as requested by management 
Fundamentals

Education: High school diploma or equivalent.
Experience in customer service.  
Must possess a valid driver’s license.
Has excellent driving record.
Ability to positively communicate and interact with all hotel departments.
Flexibility to work any shift including evenings, weekends and holidays. 
Proficiency in English required.  A second language is desirable.
Ability to grasp, lift and or carry, or otherwise, move goods weighing a maximum of 100 lbs.
Ability to stand for long periods of time.
EOE AA- Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
Study Hotels is a drug free workplace. Pre-employment drug test and background check required.
cover_letter:
Sam Chandler  
October 12, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my enthusiasm for the Valet Attendant position at The Study at Yale. With a comprehensive background in customer service and a passion for creating memorable experiences, I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to your team and enhance the guest experience at your esteemed establishment.

My career has afforded me the skills necessary to excel in fast-paced, guest-focused environments, as demonstrated during my time as an Inside Sales Representative for the New York Yankees. In this role, I honed my ability to communicate effectively and build strong, lasting relationships with clients, ensuring their needs were met with the utmost professionalism and care. These skills directly translate to the hospitality industry, where greeting guests warmly and addressing their needs with precision is paramount.

While working as an Athletic Fundraising Intern at GauchoFund, I organized and coordinated donor hospitality events, ensuring that every detail sought to provide a seamless, enjoyable experience. This attention to guest satisfaction is crucial for the role of Valet Attendant, where positive interaction and courteous service are the top priorities. Additionally, my proven ability to manage logistics and maintain accurate records will ensure the organization and security of guests' vehicle information.

Moreover, my diverse experiences, including my role in social media management, have enhanced my interpersonal communication abilities, and my educational background in Communication, with advanced Spanish proficiency, equips me to engage effectively with a diverse clientele. I am adept at anticipating guest needs and adapting to various situations, making me a well-suited candidate for The Study at Yale's commitment to exemplary service.

I am excited about the possibility of joining The Study at Yale and contributing to its mission of delivering outstanding guest experiences. Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss how my background, skills, and enthusiasm align with the goals of your team.

Sincerely,  
Sam Chandler

focus_areas: legal field
job_description:
The Office of the Governor’s Legal Counsel is a fast-paced environment that provides an opportunity for our co-ops to observe the intersection of law, policy, and politics on Beacon Hill. The office has a role in virtually every major policy initiative of the Governor and Legislature. It advises the Governor and senior staff on all enacted legislation and implementing regulations; collaborates with agency counsel and the Attorney General’s Office on litigation involving state agencies; drafts legislation and executive orders; oversees extradition, clemency, and other criminal matters; and counsels on ethics and public records act issues. The office also handles a host of complex legal issues arising daily, requiring agile research, investigation and response.
Legal co-ops work with the Governor’s Chief Legal Counsel and Deputy Legal Counsels to support the administration’s work across state government and all executive secretariats.
cover_letter:
Liana Brown  
October 14, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my strong interest in the Legal Co-op position at the Office of the Governor. With a foundational education in law and extensive hands-on experience gained through diverse legal internships, I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to your legal team, supporting the critical work that intersects with law, policy, and politics on Beacon Hill.  

Currently a Juris Doctor candidate at Northeastern University School of Law, I have developed a solid understanding of various legal fields, including intellectual property, commercial transactions, and labor law. My role as a Student Attorney at the Intellectual Property Law Clinic provided me with direct client interaction experience, allowing me to hone my skills in fact investigation, legal research, and document preparation. This experience, coupled with my prior legal internship at Keurig Dr Pepper, where I gained insight into regulatory compliance, litigation, and internal client guidance, positions me well to contribute effectively to the diverse legal challenges faced by your office.  

My educational background also includes a Bachelor of Arts in Public Relations and Political Science from Syracuse University, where I graduated magna cum laude. This academic foundation, combined with my practical experience during law school, has equipped me with a comprehensive understanding of how legal frameworks support and influence governance and policy-making processes. I am particularly adept at collaborating with cross-functional teams, a skill I refined during my tenure at Intele Peer, aligning marketing and legal objectives with strategic business goals.  

I am eager to bring my passion for the law and my commitment to public service to the Office of the Governor. The opportunity to work alongside the Governor’s Chief Legal Counsel and Deputy Legal Counsels is an exciting prospect that I believe will further develop my legal acumen and contribute to the impactful work being carried out within the state government across all executive secretariats.  

Sincerely,  
Liana Brown

focus_areas: Hospitality
job_description: Front Desk Agents are responsible for providing a five-star welcome and departure experience to each guest, as well as, serving as ambassadors throughout the guest’s stay. Front Desk Agents make the first impression upon our guests by extending a warm welcome, providing information about the hotel and local area, and offering our full range of upscale hotel amenities and services to them. Front Desk Agents are also responsible for settling guest accounts upon check-out, resolving guest issues and completing special requests. They work closely with all hotel departments especially our Guest Services, Bell-Door and Sales teams.
cover_letter:
Sam Chandler  
October 19, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my enthusiasm for the Front Desk Agent position. With a Bachelor of Arts in Communication and extensive experience in customer-facing roles, I am well-equipped to deliver the five-star experience that your establishment aims to provide. My background has endowed me with strong interpersonal skills and a proactive approach to understanding and catering to client needs, making me a perfect fit for this role.

During my time with the New York Yankees, I honed my ability to create a welcoming and engaging environment for clients. My role as an Inside Sales Representative required exceptional communication skills, as I often initiated contact with potential clients, converting leads into valuable relationships. This experience taught me the importance of building rapport quickly, a skill that I believe is crucial for creating memorable first impressions with guests.

Additionally, my previous experience as an Athletic Fundraising Intern at GauchoFund provided me with insight into coordinating events and ensuring seamless guest experiences. Organizing hospitality events allowed me to engage directly with attendees, similar to the Front Desk Agent role's interaction with hotel guests. Furthermore, my fluency in Spanish will enable me to communicate effectively with a diverse range of guests, enhancing their overall stay by making them feel understood and welcomed.

I am particularly drawn to this position because it offers a unique opportunity to serve as an ambassador for not only the hotel but also the local area. I thrive in dynamic environments where I can collaborate with different departments to ensure that guest needs are anticipated and met with efficiency and warmth. I am excited about the prospect of being a part of a team that values top-tier guest service and strives to exceed expectations.

Sincerely,  
Sam Chandler

focus_areas: Cashier and Customer Service
job_description:
• 1 year sales or customer service experience preferred
• High School Diploma or equivalent
What you'll be doing day to day
• Build loyalty by ensuring customers have a positive final touchpoint during the IKEA shopping experience
• Provides an efficient and accurate checkout experience in various areas of the store
• Offers additional products and services such as home delivery, credit card, and IKEA Family card
• Resolves customer concerns independently to meet their unique needs and expectations
• Provides friendly, safe, and efficient car loading and unloading services
Together as a Team
At IKEA it’s all about our customers, and in Customer Relations we build and retain long-lasting relationships with new and existing customers in a multichannel retail environment. We’re a diverse team that work together to ensure a positive and joyful experience for all IKEA visitors and customers: we set up services, gather feedback and make things right! Our modus operandi is to connect to people by listening to their personal needs and to create genuine interactions. We’re a bunch of people who are truly passionate about people!
QUALIFICATIONS
• 1 year sales or customer service experience preferred
• High School Diploma or equivalent
cover_letter:
Jacob Zucker  
December 17, 2024  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Customer Relations Associate position at IKEA. With a background in developing engaging experiences and ensuring a positive environment for diverse groups, I believe I am well-equipped to contribute to the IKEA team and reinforce the renowned customer-centric experience.

While working as a Nature Program Specialist and Camp Counselor at Camp Alonim, I honed my ability to listen actively and engage with individuals from multiple backgrounds, fostering a collaborative atmosphere. The role required me to assume responsibility for designing enjoyable and safe activities, while also resolving conflicts and addressing unique needs, paralleling the skillset needed to resolve customer concerns efficiently at IKEA.

My recent volunteer experience at DESK Food Pantry has further strengthened my capabilities in managing customer interactions within a fast-paced environment. By organizing stations and welcoming clients, I gained an understanding of the significance of the final touchpoint in ensuring satisfaction and loyalty—an aspect I am excited to bring to the forefront at IKEA by providing efficient checkout and promoting the added value of IKEA products and services like the Family card.

I am particularly drawn to the opportunity at IKEA because of the company's commitment to creating joy-filled experiences through genuine customer interactions. I am confident in my ability to achieve this as part of your diverse and passionate team, using my adaptability, open-mindedness, and compassion to contribute positively to IKEA's multichannel retail environment.

Sincerely,  
Jacob Zucker
