job_description:
Via is using technology to transform transportation around the world. From changing a single person’s daily commute to reducing humanity’s collective environmental footprint — we’ve got huge goals.

As an Operations & Expansion Associate, you will responsible for delivering launch projects on time while collaborating both with our partners in (the market: US / Europe, etc), our technical teams and our operational teams.

What You’ll Do:

Launch new Via deployments, take full ownership in ensuring every aspect of new deployments is executed on time at the highest possible quality
Contribute to the strategic decision-making, rigorous project planning, and entrepreneurial approach required to set up Via operations in a new market
Serve as the main point of contact for our partners, helping them develop and grow a fully operational on-demand transit system
Manage product expectations and development, ensuring that our engineering team is getting the feedback they need to build the best product possible
Tap Via’s in-house operational and marketing knowledge base to help partners get the most out our technology
Adeptly interpret and utilize mass quantities of proprietary data to generate insights and make business recommendations that will ensure success for our partner services
Who You Are:

Effective at managing multiple tasks simultaneously and comfortable taking on responsibility and working in an independent manner
Meticulous and vigilant, with a high level of attention to detail
Problem solver; you don’t accept the status quo and are always looking for creative solutions
Excellent communicator with a knack for always finding the right tone
Have a Bachelor's Degree and a record of exceptional academic achievement
Minimum of 0-2 years of work experience
Demonstrated record of entrepreneurial achievement and/or leadership a plus
Based in the NYC area and able to work in office
Open to travel
Compensation and Benefits: 

Final salary will be determined by the candidate’s experience, knowledge, and skills. Salary reflected does not include equity or variable pay, where applicable
Salary Range: $65,000-$85,000
We are proud to offer a generous and comprehensive benefits package, including free medical plans and 401K matching.
Founded in 2012, Via pioneered the TransitTech category by using new technologies to develop public mobility systems — optimizing networks of buses, shuttles, wheelchair accessible vehicles, school buses, autonomous vehicles, and electric vehicles around the globe. 

Building the world's most efficient, equitable, and sustainable transportation network for all passengers — including those with limited mobility, those without smartphones, and unbanked populations — Via works with its partners to lower the costs of public transit while providing transportation options that rival the convenience of a personal car while reducing environmental impact. 

At the intersection of transportation and technology, Via is a visionary market leader that combines software innovation with sophisticated service design and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves, providing technology in 650 communities and more than 35 countries and counting.

Ready to join the ride?
cover_letter:
Bennett Cooper  
January 16, 2025  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my enthusiasm for the Operations & Expansion Associate position at Via. Your mission to transform global transportation resonates deeply with my professional background and personal interests, particularly in leveraging technology for sustainable development. With my experience in managing partner accounts and a strong foundation in strategic planning, I am eager to contribute to the launch and expansion of Via deployments.

During my role as a Partner Account Manager at Human Interest, I honed my skills in managing over 40 partner accounts, which required meticulous attention to detail and exceptional communication abilities. I successfully coordinated with various stakeholders and delivered clear product updates, always prioritizing the partners' needs and engagement. This experience, coupled with my academic background in Political Science and Environment & Society, has equipped me with the analytical skills required to interpret and utilize data to drive business decisions effectively.

Previously, as an Associate District Manager at ADP, I took full responsibility for building a robust network of referring partners nationwide, achieving over 120% of sales targets. This role required an entrepreneurial mindset and problem-solving skills to adapt to different challenges and secure business growth. The ability to manage multiple tasks and deliver strategic insights will be directly applicable to the fast-paced environment at Via, where launching new markets demands both precision and creativity.

Additionally, my internship at the Environmental Protection Agency allowed me to develop a profound understanding of environmental issues, which aligns with Via’s vision of reducing transportation's environmental footprint. As someone based in NYC and open to travel, I am well-positioned to collaborate with teams across various markets and contribute to the launch of innovative, equitable transit solutions.

I am excited about the prospect of joining Via and being part of a team that is at the forefront of transforming global transportation. Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to further discuss how my skills and experiences can contribute to Via's continued success.

Sincerely,  
Bennett Cooper

focus_areas: critical thinking, data driven, attention to detail
job_description:
NRG is a leading global insights and strategy firm at the confluence of content, culture, and technology. We stay ahead of what ’ s next, providing fresh insights to spark new ideas. We ’ re a trusted partner to our clients, working behind the scenes to bring imagination, depth, and clarity to their biggest challenges — in entertainment, technology, lifestyle, sports, and gaming. Together, we create with confidence.

We’re proud of our company’s values – these values guide us as we navigate sunny days, gray skies and everything in between:

  Do what you love. With conviction. 
 Where discovery lives. And impact drives. 
 Celebrate difference. Cultivate belonging. 
 Big thinking. Collectively inspired. 
 Embrace the journey. Be human. 


 The Opportunity 

We are seeking a passionate and inquisitive Analyst or Sr. Analyst to join our Client Services team. Our Client Services team is made up of world class researchers who bring unmatched industry expertise, a global perspective, and passion for all consumers in the rapidly evolving entertainment, technology, gaming, sports and lifestyle landscapes. This team works on research initiatives that help answer the most important strategic business questions for some of the world’s biggest brands! They help our clients leverage consumer insights to challenge conventional thinking, uncover new ideas, build better experiences, and continue to grow and innovate. Their rigorous research and expert consulting guide our clients to create their next story, product or strategy.

In this role, you will support a wide range of initiatives across the full project lifecycle from proposal to report delivery. If you’re passionate about qualitative and quantitative research; if you enjoy visualizing data and discovering insights with confidence; and are looking for a great opportunity to start your career where you can make an impact, this opportunity is for you!

 Your Impact 

  Support all phases of quantitative and qualitative research projects, including research design, questionnaire and discussion guide development, data analysis and storytelling.
 Projects may include methods such as concept evaluation, brand studies, content optimization tests, messaging/positioning evaluation, creative materials tests, market sizing and segmentation. 
 Help drive quality control processes at each step of the research lifecycle, from checking survey programming logic, questionnaire proofing, number checking and proofing reports and presentations for accuracy. 
 Partner with internal and external operations teams (programming, fieldwork, facilities, moderators, data processing) to drive projects forward on stringent timelines. 
 Assist with translating data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations through visual, creative and story-driven reports. 

Who We're Looking For

 Must haves: 

  Curiosity and Critical Thinking– You are genuinely interested in seeking information on the “whys,” always digging for more information to understand what makes consumers tick. Whether it’s understanding why one marketing message is more effective than another or what consumers think we could be using AI for in the future, you can always find something interesting to sink your teeth into. Simply put, you love to learn. 
 Problem Solver– You are a natural problem solver. When something doesn’t go as planned, your first instinct is to look for a solution, rather than viewing it as a roadblock. You’re always on the lookout for new ways to accomplish tasks and have the ability to address issues using creative and collaborative tactics. 
 Data Driven– You’re comfortable working with data to identify trends and insights, including both structured (i.e. data and hard numbers) and unstructured (i.e. interviews and qualitative) data. Experience visualizing data with tools such as Excel, PowerPoint, Google Docs and Slides is preferred. 
 Self-starter – Internally-motivated who continuously strives to get things done well, regardless of challenges encountered. You are proactive and always keep an eye on the next step. 
 Clear and Proactive Communicator– You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and are able to communicate clearly and succinctly. You’re comfortable asking questions and sharing your point of view. 
 Hawk-eyed attention to detail – You notice when font sizes change unexpectedly or a proper noun isn’t capitalized. Errors don’t get past you and you are always focused on ensuring high levels of quality control and reporting. 
 Expert multitasker – Successfully manages time and multiple competing priorities to ensure deadlines are always met. Staying organized is a must for managing projects! 
 Great Team Member – T eam player who works collaboratively and harmoniously within a team and across teams. You are comfortable forming connections with colleagues remotely whether that be jumping on a quick video meeting, picking up the phone for a call or chatting with them through IMs. You welcome feedback because you have a zest for learning and growing. You will roll up your sleeves to help get the job done and no task is beneath you. 
 Your degree(s) – You have a B.A./B.S. degree in areas such as Social Sciences, Psychology, Business, Marketing, Market Research, Statistics, Economics or a r elated field. Additional degrees are welcome! 


 Bonus attributes (nice-to-haves but not required): 

  Passion – A passion or desire to learn about technology, entertainment, sports and/or lifestyle sectors. You enjoy or are excited by the prospect of staying up to date on industry trends and developments. 
 Prior Experience – Prior internship or work experience in market research or consumer insights is a plus. If you don’t have relevant work experience, we would love to hear about academic qualitative or quantitative research projects, such as primary survey research, experimental psychology studies, social media analysis, ethnographic research, or any other relevant projects. 
 Data analysis techniques and software– Familiarity with any of the following data analysis techniques would be awesome: statistical significance testing, correlation analysis, multivariate analysis techniques (such as cluster/segmentation analysis) and conjoint and discrete choice analysis. Experience with statistical packages, like SPSS or Q, are a plus. 


 Position Type 

This is a full-time, exempt position.

What We Offer

We embrace the current era of work and what it means to be a best-in-class employer. We understand the flexibility that is required to recruit and retain incredible talent, whether it’s empowering you to do your best work from the comfort of your home or supporting you if you need to take a mental health day for self-care and rest. Below is a unique blend of benefits tailored to meeting the ever-changing professional landscape.

  Flexible/Remote work with optional usage of our great offices in Playa Vista or New York 
 Unlimited PTO, volunteer days and a generous number of recharge days including a full office closure during the week of Christmas and New Year’s 
 Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Plans 
 401K with company match 
 Generous paid Parental Leave 
 Regular performance evaluations with opportunities for promotions and merit increases 
 Educational and training reimbursement plan and other training and professional development opportunities 
 Employee perks program (includes discounts on travel, hotels, cars, fitness, movie tickets and more) 
 Resources available for mental health, inclusive care and family building 
 NRGratitude – our company-wide employee recognition program 
 Regular team/company events and activities including annual summer and holiday parties 
 Pet friendly headquarters and pet insurance options 


 Our Commitment 

Diversity, equity, and inclusion is at the center of all our practices to ensure that NRG is a place where people from all identities and backgrounds can thrive. NRG is committed to recruiting and retaining diverse talent by supporting their growth through learning programs, internal mobility, affinity group participation and leadership development. Our differences make us a stronger workforce and enhance our creativity and innovation. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

Compensation

In order to comply with equal pay and salary transparency laws in various locations, we believe the target range of base compensation in all locations within the United States for this role is $60,000 -$70,000. As part of the total compensation package, this role may be eligible for a discretionary annual bonus. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and location.

job_description:
Position Overview:
We are seeking a motivated and enthusiastic Integrated Marketing Manager to join the BLADE Marketing Team. This role will oversee the strategy, execution, and performance of campaigns across email, SMS, in-app messaging, push notifications, and other owned channels to drive customer engagement, retention, and growth. The ideal candidate is passionate about marketing, eager to learn, and capable of multitasking in a fast-paced environment.

The ideal candidate is both a creative thinker and a data-driven decision-maker, with a proven track record of optimizing marketing performance and delivering personalized, omnichannel customer experiences.

About the role

As our Integrated Marketing Manager, you will:

Owned Channel Strategy & Execution

Develop and execute an integrated marketing strategy for owned channels, ensuring alignment with broader marketing and business objectives.
Design and implement personalized, data-driven campaigns across email, push, SMS, and in-app messaging using Braze and Attentive.
Own the content calendar for owned channels, coordinating with creative, product, and other marketing teams to deliver cohesive messaging.
Support the creation of marketing collateral, including push notifications, social media content (Instagram and TikTok), emails, and promotional materials
Optimize the flow and cadence of communications across e-mail, app, and website
Performance Analysis & Optimization

Lifecycle Marketing: utilize Braze to build, test, and optimize campaigns, including segmentation, personalization, and journey orchestration.
Analyze campaign performance, generating insights to inform strategy and improve KPIs such as open rates, CTR, conversion rates, and customer retention.
Conduct ongoing testing (A/B and multivariate) to optimize messaging, timing, and audience segmentation.
Report regularly on campaign results and opportunities for improvement to stakeholders
Product Marketing and Cross-Functional Collaboration

Assist with the coordination of events, marketing flights, and other promotional activities, including logistical planning, vendor management, and onsite support
Develop an in-depth understanding of current business policies/procedures/pricing and operations while determining optimal program execution methods to improve ROI as well as retention
Help define short- and long-term initiatives that support business goals and program measurements of success; gain necessary internal alignment, and personally see those initiatives through from conception to execution ensuring the expected quality and on-time execution
What We Look For

Required:

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
2-3 years of experience in integrated or digital marketing with a focus on owned channels
Proficient knowledge and hands-on experience with Braze (certification preferred)
Familiarity with CRM systems, audience segmentation, and data enrichment techniques.
Proficient knowledge of Figma, and Photoshop
Proficiency in content creation on social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Linkedin)
Proven success in creating and managing omnichannel marketing campaigns
Strong analytical skills with experience using tools like Google Analytics, Tableau, or similar
Exceptional project management and organizational skills, with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
Knowledge of HTML/CSS for email templates is a plus.
Must exhibit a professional personal presentation and brand, strong competency in project management, and the ability to rapidly learn new marketing software systems
Preferred:

Strategic + Hands-On: Experience crafting strategy as well as tactical implementation.
Data-Driven + Excellent Communication Skills: Strong analytical skills in analyzing large data sets and turning them into actionable insights.
Self-Motivated + Team-Oriented: works well independently and collaboratively with all levels of the organization.
Decisive + Accountable: Must demonstrate sound decision-making and the ability to react quickly under pressure, which requires being organized, having strong project management skills, with a proven track record of delivering high-quality work under tight timelines.
Those who excel at Blade are entrepreneurial, nimble, scrappy and have a strong work ethic.
Salary: This role will pay an annual salary between $80,000 and $90,000 per year.
cover_letter:
Bennett Cooper  
January 17, 2025

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my enthusiasm for the Integrated Marketing Manager position at BLADE. With a robust background in integrated and digital marketing combined with proven analytical skills and a strong professional demeanor, I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to BLADE’s mission of delivering exceptional customer experiences through innovative and personalized marketing strategies.

In my recent role as a Partner Account Manager at Human Interest, I successfully managed over 40 partner accounts, demonstrating my ability to develop and execute effective communication strategies across various channels. My experience at ADP as an Associate District Manager further honed my skills in relationship-building and strategic planning, as I achieved 120% of my sales plan by leveraging partnerships and crafting targeted outreach efforts. These roles have equipped me with the expertise to oversee the strategy, execution, and performance of multi-channel campaigns, aligning perfectly with the responsibilities you outlined.

I have extensive hands-on experience with data-driven marketing platforms, including leveraging CRM tools and segmentation techniques to optimize campaigns for increased engagement and retention. My proficiency with tools like Braze and my analytical approach with platforms such as Google Analytics enable me to not only build and optimize omnichannel marketing campaigns but also generate meaningful insights to drive business growth. My solid foundation in using metrics to enhance marketing performance is well-aligned with the performance analysis and optimization aspect of this role.

Beyond technical skills, I bring a collaborative spirit and professional acumen reflected in my participation in cross-functional initiatives at the Environmental Protection Agency, where I presented comprehensive research reports and supported strategic communication efforts. This ability to work independently and as part of a team underpins my capacity to deliver high-quality work under tight timelines, a quality that I understand is crucial to the culture at BLADE.

I am eager to bring my passion for marketing and my commitment to driving results to BLADE as an Integrated Marketing Manager. Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the possibility of discussing how I can contribute to your team.

Sincerely,  
Bennett Cooper

job_description:
CAIS is the pioneer in democratizing access to and education about alternative investments for independent financial advisors, empowering them to engage and transact with leading asset managers on a massive scale through a wide variety of alternative investment products and technology solutions. CAIS provides financial advisors with a broad selection of alternative investment strategies, including hedge funds, private equity, private credit, real estate, digital assets, and structured notes. CAIS also delivers industry-leading technology, operational efficiency, and world-class client service throughout the pre-trade, trade, and post-trade experience. CAIS supports over 50,000 advisors who oversee more than $6 trillion in network assets.  

The firm is seeking an Investments Research Assistant to support the Investments team with a wide range of research and administrative tasks. The ideal candidates for this role will be resourceful, organized, and possess a high level of attention to detail. Given the role’s exposure, the ideal candidate also will have refined interpersonal and communication skills. For the right candidate, this opportunity provides an exceptional pathway for growth and development.  

Responsibilities 

Maintain complex and detailed calendars for the team
Coordinate and manage both internal and external meetings
Create and format PowerPoint presentations and proposals for meetings and presentations.
Assist in the preparation of materials for meetings, ensuring all necessary documents and information are available
Arrange and oversee intricate domestic and international travel plans
Organize all facets of offsite conferences and external events
Process invoices and T&E expense claims for team members, ensuring compliance with policies and procedures
Collaborate effectively with the administrative assistants team to ensure seamless support and operations 
Qualifications 

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
0-2 years of administrative experience, preferably in a high-paced, deadline-driven environment
Exceptional organizational skills and keen attention to detail
Ability to handle confidential information with discretion
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, especially PowerPoint
Experience in the finance industry or with alternative investments
Demonstrated experience in creating PowerPoint presentations and proposals
Experience with meeting preparation and coordination 
CAIS is consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work, and our culture is at the heart of our success. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where employees can be their most authentic selves and feel inspired and supported to bring their voice forward to drive community, growth, and innovation. We are an equal opportunity employer, and do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law.  Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at https://www.caisgroup.com/our-company/careers. 

CAIS’ compensation package includes a market competitive salary, a performance bonus, and exceptional benefits. If you are located in New York, New York, the base salary range for this role is $65,000 - $75,000. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. 

CAIS offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes generously subsidized healthcare with 100% employer paid dental and vision insurance, an employer matched retirement plan, wellness programs, and generous PTO and parental leave. Additionally, CAIS offers a flexible, hybrid in-office model; for most roles, we do not require a minimum number of days in office per week. For more information on our benefits and career opportunities, please visit our website: https://www.caisgroup.com/our-company/careers.
cover_letter:
Bennett Cooper  
January 23, 2025  

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the Investments Research Assistant position at CAIS. With a background in account management, a keen attention to detail, and a strong foundation in research, I am confident in my ability to contribute effectively to the Investments team and support the organization's mission of empowering financial advisors in the field of alternative investments.

During my previous role as a Partner Account Manager at Human Interest, I honed my skills in managing multiple priorities and maintaining organized, efficient workflows. This experience equipped me with exceptional organizational skills and an ability to handle confidential information with discretion—key qualifications for the Investments Research Assistant role. Additionally, my work at ADP further strengthened my communication skills, as I presented complex information to partners and clients, experiences that mirror the PowerPoint presentation preparation required for this position.

Furthermore, my internship with the Environmental Protection Agency provided me with substantial research experience, including creating comprehensive reports and daily media monitoring. This research capacity, combined with my proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite developed through various roles, aligns well with the tasks of preparing meeting materials and handling complex arrangements expected in this position. 

I am enthusiastic about the opportunity to join CAIS, a company renowned for its innovative approach to alternative investments. I am attracted to your commitment to fostering an inclusive environment, and I am eager to bring my skills in collaboration and operational support to your team. I am particularly drawn to this role due to the potential for growth and development, and I am excited at the prospect of contributing to an organization that supports such a vast network of advisors and assets.

Sincerely,  
Bennett Cooper

job_description:
Analyst, Digital Sports Inventory
1221 Avenue of The Americas, New York, NEW YORK
Full-time
Business Segment: Ad Sales
Company Description
We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.
Job Description
As a Digital Inventory Analyst, you will be primarily responsible for the processing of inventory-related requests for the NBC Sports properties.  You will determine inventory availability and usage patterns, and coordinate with the Planning team within a fast-paced environment.

 Duties and Responsibilities

Track and report on digital media inventory across Peacock and NBCSports digital properties – Sports include NFL, Golf, NBA, B1G & ND Football, College Basketball, NASCAR, Premier League, US Soccer, Chivas, as well as other Tentpole Sports (Olympics, World Cup, etc).
Forecasting and allocating Video and Display advertising inventory for NBCU Digital Portfolio across all platforms using several tools, including ad server forecasting (FreeWheel & Google Ad Manager).
Collaborate with National Sales Planners with on-request inventory avails, and final sign off on media plans, with emphasis on Demo Guaranteed and Advanced Audience Targeted buys.
Manage effects of programming changes, campaign changes and shifts through systems approval queue
Work with Ops and Planning to optimize yield & provide input and solutions to address campaigns at risk.
Liaise with numerous internal departments such as: Planning, Sales, Operations, Programming, Distribution, Products, Research, Data Insights and Marketing.
Maintain and manage reports for Sales and Planning on a routine and ad hoc basis
On an as-needed basis, project-based work (systems and process improvement) to support department Directors and VP
Routine meetings with Manager to discuss pending issues, resolve problems, and forecast inventory
Assist with trainings/presentations for inventory, planning, or other teams we collaborate with
Keep abreast of industry news via trades to increase and strengthen knowledge of Ad Sales and get a general/broad understanding of industry, including relevant sports properties.
Qualifications
Four year degree or equivalent experience
1+ year Sales Planner, Analyst, or Digital Service Representative experience in Media Ad Sales
Proven ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, deadline-driven media environment
Expert understanding of Media Math
Strong Analytical problem solving skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)
Eligibility Requirements

Interested candidates must submit a resume/CV through www.nbcunicareers.com to be considered
Willingness to travel and work overtime, and on weekends with short notice
Must be willing to work in New York, NY in a hybrid capacity
Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States
Must be 18 years or older
Desired Characteristics

Career interest in Strategic Planning; Sports experience is a plus
Excellent computer skills, demonstrated analytical ability and organizational/project management skills
Proficient in MS Office, particularly Excel (Intermediate Level)
Knowledge of Operative.One or similar Order Mgmt. System, Freewheel, Google Ad Manager (GAM), or Nielsen DAR.
Proven ability to multi-task and meet deadlines
Strong verbal and written communication skills with proven ability to negotiate effectively with all levels within the organization (Customer Service Oriented)
Additional Requirements

Hybrid: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.

This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.

Salary range: $70,000 - $75,000

With a robust background in account management and a proven track record of building and maintaining strategic partnerships, I am eager to leverage these skills in contributing to the innovative Ad Sales team at NBC Sports. My experience in fast-paced sales environments, combined with my analytical problem-solving abilities, align well with the requirements of this role.

At ADP, I honed my skills in managing a network of over 20 referring partners, which resulted in securing more than 75% of total business through strategic customer acquisition and retention. My responsibilities there, including deal negotiation and closing, taught me the importance of data-driven decision-making in optimizing sales strategies. I am particularly drawn to NBCUniversal's commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion and am excited about the opportunity to contribute to a workplace that values these principles as much as I do. NBCUniversal’s reputation for producing world-class content aligns with my career aspirations and passion for strategic planning and the sports industry. Moreover, my strong verbal and written communication skills will be pivotal in effectively liaising with multiple departments and driving cross-functional collaboration.

Sincerely,  
Bennett Cooper

job_description:
Headquartered in New York with a nationally-scaled platform, RXR is a 450+ person, vertically integrated investment manager with expertise in a wide array of value creation activities, including acquisitions, asset and portfolio management, property operations, development, construction, leasing, and technological innovation. RXR is an active investor in real estate credit, rental housing, commercial property, and property technology through value-added and opportunistic investment strategies.

The Associate role will provide essential support to the Equity Capital Markets Team for their capital raising efforts in a sales support capacity. This role will be responsible for supporting senior members of the capital team in developing real estate investment product marketing presentations, participating in capital raising operations and execution, performing investor and investment market research, and participating in other workstreams as necessary to successfully develop new and existing investor relationships and capitalize RXR's investment strategies. The position entails working in a dynamic and growing Equity Capital Markets team, as well as liaising with other teams across the firm such as RXR's Acquisitions, Asset Management, and Credit teams, as RXR seeks to capitalize existing and new investment offerings for its clients. The Associate will engage with a diverse range of global institutional and non-institutional investors, including some of the world's largest capital allocators.

A successful associate will be proactive, tenacious and possess extreme organizational skills.

Responsibilities 

 

Develop and manage investor presentations for various RXR investment vehicles, strategies, and transactions 
Develop and maintain presentations to the highest possible quality working closely with other members of the Equity Capital Markets team and Chief Strategy Officer, Head of Equity Capital Markets
Perform market research to bolster strategic narrative with real time data
Manage version control and distribution of various marketing materials
Participate in the creation of ad-hoc marketing or update materials for specific RXR partners or investors
Work with RXR's Chief Compliance Officer to ensure offering materials and the distribution of the same are compliant with applicable regulations 
Assist in the creation of investment vehicle documentation and diligence materials 
Participate in creation of Private Placement Memorandums ("PPMs"), Due Diligence Questionnaires ("DDQs"), Limited Partnership Agreements ("LPAs"), and other legal documentation
Participate in the production, maintenance, and distribution of file repositors ("Data Rooms") for assigned RXR investment products 
Participate in investor outreach and follow up management 
Perform investor market research to create regular internal reports on investor announcements / press releases, Requests for Proposals ("RFPs"), and other data that may indicate an investor's interest in RXR offerings.
Assist in preparing distinct prospect lists for specific offerings by using data tools, such as Preqin, RXR's internal data, and other sources of investor market insights.
Organize investor meetings and coordinate related logistics
Participate in certain prospective and existing investor meetings
Track all investor correspondence through RXR's Customer Relationship Management system ("CRM") and ensure timely communications and responses to prospective investors
Liaise with other RXR teams and verticals to prepare responses to investor diligence questions
Manage Non-Disclosure Agreement preparation, distribution, negotiation, and execution
Participate in updating reoccurring internal Equity Capital Markets reporting 
Qualifications



Systems Proficiency: Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Communication and Outreach: Participate in investor outreach and follow up management; track and manage all correspondence in a timely manner, with the ability to influence.
Presentation Ability: Expert ability to create clear and persuasive investor presentations and specific marketing materials for various investment vehicles, strategies, and transactions. Ensure materials and distribution of the same are compliant with applicable regulations.
Documentation and Diligence: Conduct market research and assist in the creation of investment vehicle documentation and diligence materials. Develop legal documentation including Private Placement Memorandums, Due Diligence Questionnaires, Limited Partnership Agreements. Produce, maintain, and distribute file repositors for assigned investment products.
Outstanding organization skills: Detail oriented, proactive, efficient, strategic, and able to multitask. Able to proactively prioritize multiple work streams and progress distinct projects simultaneously
Willingness and ability to work long and off hours.
Ability to operate with high levels of confidentiality
High degree of personal and professional integrity
Understanding of real estate fundamentals, financing principles, and capital structures



Experience & Education



Bachelor's Degree
1-3 years of experience in either a capital raising sales support role, or marketing role, preferably within real estate finance
Experience creating investment product marketing presentations
Experience with investment product documentation (e.g. Private Placement Memos; Offering Memos)
Experience using Customer Relationship Management software
Experience answering due diligence questionnaires
Experience with investor relations and prospective investor communications
Experience participating in website and social media content creation, specifically as it relates to investment strategy and firm-wide investment capabilities 





The salary range and/or hourly rate listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future. When determining a team member's base salary/rate, several factors may be considered as applicable (e.g. location, years of service, specialty, education, relevant experience).

Bonus eligible.

Pay Range

$100,000—$125,000 USD

RXR is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to recruiting, hiring and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds regardless of gender, race, color, creed, national origin, religion, age, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. 

RXR is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, RXR will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact 516-506-6847.
cover_letter:
Bennett Cooper  
January 24, 2025  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Associate position with RXR's Equity Capital Markets Team. With a background in account and district management, coupled with strong presentation and outreach abilities, I am eager to bring my skills to your dynamic team. I am drawn to RXR's reputation in the industry and its comprehensive approach to real estate investment, which aligns seamlessly with my professional experiences and aspirations.

In my previous role as a Partner Account Manager at Human Interest, I managed over 40 partner accounts and facilitated effective communication strategies that significantly enhanced partner engagement. My experience in crafting and conveying clear, persuasive messages in high-stakes environments has honed my presentation abilities, a skill set that will be instrumental in developing top-tier investor presentations for various RXR investment vehicles. Additionally, my time as an Associate District Manager at ADP allowed me to refine my outreach techniques and manage extensive partner networks, successfully leveraging relationships for substantial business growth.

Maintaining the highest level of professional integrity and organizational skills has been a hallmark of my career. I have a proven track record of excelling in fast-paced environments while managing multiple workstreams effectively. My involvement in tasks requiring acute attention to detail, such as supporting senior team members in developing marketing presentations and adhering to compliance through meticulous documentation and diligence, positions me as an asset to the Equity Capital Markets Team.

Joining RXR presents an exciting opportunity to engage with global institutional investors and contribute significantly to your capital raising efforts. I am enthusiastic about the prospect of working collaboratively across various teams and contributing to the capital infrastructure at RXR, ensuring the successful realization of your investment strategies.

Sincerely,  
Bennett Cooper

job_description:
Data Scientist, Marketing Inference
US - Remote
Who are we and why should you join us?
BetterHelp is on a mission to remove the traditional barriers to therapy and make mental health care more accessible to everyone. Founded in 2013, we are now the world’s largest online therapy service – providing affordable and convenient therapy in 210 countries and over 60 languages across the globe. Our network of over 30,000 licensed therapists has helped millions of people take ownership of their mental health and change their lives forever. And we’re not stopping there – as the unmet need for mental health services continues to grow, BetterHelp is committed to being part of the solution.


As a Data Scientist at BetterHelp, you’ll join a diverse team of licensed clinicians, engineers, product pros, creatives, marketers, and business leaders who share a passion for expanding access to therapy. And as a mental health company, we take employee mental health just as seriously as we do our mission. We deeply invest in our team’s well-being and professional development, because we know that business and individual growth go hand-in-hand. At BetterHelp, you’ll carve your own path, make an immediate impact, and be challenged every day – with a supportive community behind you the whole way.

What are we looking for?
BetterHelp is looking for a Data Scientist to help us scale and increase our impact. You will use cutting-edge methods to optimize our marketing efforts. The ideal candidate would have experience analyzing large and complex data sets related to web products. You'll be contributing to efforts in marketing inference, including our Marketing Mix Model and Attribution.

What will you do?
Get insight from an enormous amount of data, and take a proactive role partnering with the marketing team in finding and testing data-driven ideas for improving our efficiency.
Contribute to the development, implementation, and maintenance of our marketing models, including a Bayesian Marketing Mix Model and a Data-Driven Attribution model.
Monitor and analyze marketing uplift tests with statistical rigor, present the data and insights to the team, and drive marketing decisions.
Look at complex problems and come up with testable models and algorithms that have measurable business impact.
Enjoy great teamwork, have lots of fun, and take pride in building a world-class product that makes a difference in people's lives.
What will you NOT do?
You will NOT worry about "runway", "cash left", or "how much time we have until the next round". We have the startup DNA but we're fully backed and funded, all the way to success.
You will NOT be confined to your "job". You will get involved in product, marketing, business strategy, and almost everything we do.
You will NOT be bogged down by office politics, ego, or bad attitude. Only positive, pleasure-to-work-with people are allowed here!
You will NOT get yourself burned out. We work hard but we believe in maintaining a sustainable work/life balance. Really.
Can I work remotely?
Yes. We operate on PST and candidates in any time zone are welcome to apply. We ask employees to travel to our Mountain View, CA office up to three times per year plus one company-wide offsite to collaborate in person and strengthen working relationships. Travel expenses are covered and reasonable accommodations are made for those under unique circumstances who cannot travel.

Requirements
BSc/MA in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Math, Economics, Computer Science, Operations Research, or Engineering
At least 3-5 years of experience in a quantitative data analysis role involving user behavior (e.g. marketing, product, UI/UX) and large data sets
Expertise in statistics, especially as it relates to hypothesis testing and experiment design
Experience analyzing A/B tests as well as experiments with more advanced statistical methods like difference-in-difference, regression discontinuity, or other methods that deal with network effects or panel data
Experience building predictive models and causal inference models
Experience analyzing large and complex data sets to drive business insights and decisions
Expertise in using tools like R and Python for data analysis
Proven success supporting or making business decisions based on your data analysis
Excellent communication skills, with experience simplifying complex topics and communicating technical ideas with non-technical audiences
Advanced experience with SQL
Bonus (Great to have but not required)

Experience with Bayesian modeling methods
Experience with Marketing Mix Models and Multi-Touch Attribution models
Experience analyzing two-sided marketplaces
Experience with B2C, marketplace products
Experience with BI tools like Tableau and Looker
cover_letter:
Benjamin Cooper  
January 29, 2025  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Data Scientist, Marketing Inference position at BetterHelp. With a strong foundation in data analysis and a passion for leveraging data to advance healthcare solutions, I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to BetterHelp’s mission of making mental health care more accessible.

In my current role as a Healthcare Data Analyst at Boston Children’s Hospital, I lead the data efforts for the US News & World Report Pediatric Hospital Survey submission team. This role has honed my skills in managing large and complex datasets, showcasing my ability to drive data-driven decision-making within healthcare settings. My experience leading hospital initiatives to capture significant Medicaid funds and crafting impactful reports underlines my quantitative data analysis expertise—qualities that align well with the needs of the Marketing Inference team at BetterHelp.

My academic journey, including a Bachelor of Science in Bioengineering with a focus on Statistics and my ongoing Master’s in Data Science in Biomedicine, has deepened my proficiency in statistical analysis and predictive modeling. I am particularly skilled in using advanced statistical methods for hypothesis testing and experiment design—skills that are critical for analyzing marketing uplift tests and optimizing BetterHelp's marketing models. Additionally, my hands-on experience with Cipher Skin involved leading user testing and developing algorithms, providing me with practical insights that I can apply to enhance our marketing inference efforts at BetterHelp.

Moreover, my expertise with tools such as Python, SQL, and AWS will empower me to contribute meaningfully from day one, supporting the Marketing Mix Model and Attribution efforts. My ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to cross-functional teams aligns with BetterHelp's collaborative ethos, ensuring that technical ideas are accessible and actionable for all stakeholders.

Joining BetterHelp means being part of a team that values growth, both personally and professionally, within a forward-thinking environment that makes a difference in people’s lives. I am eager to bring my blend of healthcare experience, statistical expertise, and passion for data to BetterHelp, driving impactful marketing decisions and helping to further the company’s crucial mission.

Sincerely,  
Benjamin Cooper

job_description:
Data Analyst
San Francisco, CA or Remote (U.S.)
Doximity is transforming the healthcare industry. Join our mission to help every physician be more productive and provide better care for their patients. As medicine's largest network in the United States, there's an elevated level of responsibility in everything we do. We don't take that responsibility lightly and are committed to building diverse teams with an inclusive culture that can make a direct impact on the healthcare system.

One of Doximity's core values is stretching ourselves. Even if you don't check off all the boxes below we encourage you to apply. Doximity is full of exceptional people who bring their own unique experiences to work everyday and make us all better for it!

As a Data Analyst, you'll work within cross-functional delivery teams alongside other analysts, engineers, and product managers in discovering data insights to help improve healthcare.

This role can be filled in our San Francisco headquarters OR remotely in the U.S.

About Us

Here are some of the ways we bring value to doctors
Here is an introduction to our tech stack 
We use UNIX command-line interface and standard programming tools (vim/emacs, git, etc.) and have over 350 private repositories in Github containing our applications, forks of gems, our own internal gems, and open-source projects
We have worked as a distributed team for a long time; we're currently about 65% distributed
Find out more information on the Doximity engineering blog
Our company core values
Our recruiting process
Our product development cycle
Our on-boarding & mentorship process
Here's How You Will Make an Impact

Leverage Doximity's extensive datasets to identify and classify behavioral patterns of medical professionals on our platform.
Play a key role in creating both product and client-facing analytics.
Inform data team strategy by working with the product leaders and managers. Actively participate in execution and some planning of organizational data team strategy. 
Collaborate with a team of product managers, analysts, and other developers to define and lead data projects from data ingestion to analysis to recommendations.
About you

At least 2 years of professional experience as a data analyst or a data scientist.
Knowledge of statistical concepts, especially exploratory data analysis techniques, and probability theory. 
Excellent SQL skills to create and evaluate complex statements involving numerous tables and data relationships.
Excellent visualization and storytelling skills to explain your results and solutions to the stakeholders, clearly and compellingly.
Proficient in using Python data analysis libraries such as Pandas and Numpy. Also has a basic understanding of the object-oriented programming concepts as it relates to Python.
Prior exposure to distributed data processing concepts and execution (e.g., working with column stores, leveraging spark, etc.)
Fast learner; curiosity about and passion for data.
Compensation

The US total compensation range for this full-time position is $110,000 - $150,000 (inclusive of salary + equity). Our ranges are determined by role and level. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the approximate total target compensation for the position across the US. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including relevant skills, experience, and education/training. Please note that the compensation listed does not include benefits.

Benefits

Doximity is proud to offer industry-leading benefits. Some of our offerings include: 

Medical, dental, vision offerings for you and your family
401k with matching program
Employee stock purchase plan
Family planning support, Childcare FSA, and parental leave
Life, AD&D, and Disability
Generous time off, holidays and paid company trips
Wellness benefits…plus many more!
More info on Doximity

For the past decade, it’s been our mission to help every physician be more productive so they can provide better care for their patients. We believe that when doctors are connected, the healthcare system works better and patients benefit. Doximity enables our verified clinician members to collaborate with colleagues, stay up-to-date with the latest medical news and research, manage their careers, and conduct virtual patient visits. Today, Doximity is the leading digital platform for U.S. medical professionals, with over 80% of physicians, 50% of all nurse practitioners and physician assistants, and 90% of graduating medical students as members. 

Joining Doximity means being part of an incredibly talented and humble team passionate about improving inefficiencies in our $4.3 trillion U.S. healthcare system. We are a team of doers who solve problems everyday by treating obstacles like an adventure, and we love creating technology that has a real, meaningful impact on people’s lives. Doxers are committed to working towards a more equitable world both within and beyond our office walls. This starts by fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment where differences are valued and all employees are encouraged to bring their full, authentic selves to work daily. To learn more about our team, culture, and users, check out our careers page, company blog, and engineering blog. We’re growing fast, and there’s plenty of opportunity for you to make an impact—join us! For more information, visit Doximity.com.

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my enthusiastic interest in the Data Analyst position at Doximity. With a strong foundation in data analysis, visualization, and statistical process control gained through my education and professional experiences, I am eager to contribute to Doximity's mission of transforming the healthcare industry. My background aligns with the requirements for the role, and I am excited about the prospect of working within your dynamic and innovative team to make a meaningful impact on healthcare.

Throughout my career, particularly in my current role at Boston Children's Hospital, I have honed my SQL skills, developing complex queries and crafting detailed reports that support strategic decision-making across diverse hospital departments. These skills have been crucial in facilitating initiatives that address health disparities and drive data-driven solutions within the organization. The opportunity to leverage these capabilities to identify and classify behavioral patterns on Doximity's platform excites me, as it aligns perfectly with my passion for using data to improve healthcare outcomes.

In addition to my technical proficiency in SQL, I bring excellent data visualization and storytelling skills that are indispensable for creating compelling product and client-facing analytics. At Cipher Skin, I directed experiments and created live demos and visualizations, enabling me to convey insights effectively to various stakeholders. My experience in using Python, including Pandas and Numpy, to perform data analysis enables me to transform complex datasets into actionable insights, further enriching the value Doximity can offer to medical professionals.

I am particularly drawn to Doximity's commitment to diversity and fostering an inclusive work environment. The prospect of collaborating with cross-functional teams to define and lead impactful data projects aligns with my expertise in project management and cross-disciplinary collaboration, demonstrated through my successful leadership of data initiatives in healthcare analytics. As a fast learner with a strong curiosity about data, I am eager to contribute to your team’s strategy and drive innovation within the healthcare system.

Sincerely,  
Benjamin Cooper

job_description:
Spring 2025 Part-Time Graduate Intern, Strategic Initiatives
Remote
About Soda Health  

Soda Health is a healthcare technology company focused on building solutions which eliminate health inequities and create a healthier America. We provide a technology platform to administer benefits personalized to individual needs, delivered more cost-effectively. Our expertise in healthcare, retail and consumer experience provides us with the foundation for creating easy-to-use solutions with an experience which moves beyond transactional relationships to sustained engagement and overall health improvement. That is a win for everyone. Soda Health is a Series B stage company, backed by leading investors including Define Ventures, General Catalyst, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Pinegrove Capital Partners, and Qiming Venture Partners. 

The Job at a Glance 

Reporting up to the office of the CEO, you will help shape, scope, and deliver key organizational and go-to-market initiatives. In this role, you will support a dynamic, fast-moving leadership team by conducting market research, developing business cases for expansion, and make recommendations on cross-functional opportunities. This internship offers valuable exposure to strategic decision-making at a scaling organization in a unique, multi-industry model. 

The role will require 15-20 hours of work per week, 10 of which should be during regular business hours (Central Time) to enable live collaboration with the team. Start and end date are flexible, but a strong preference is for a four-month commitment. 

What You’ll Do 

Working within an organization created at the intersection of health care, retail, and financial technology, no two days will look the same. Typical responsibilities of this role may include: 

Conduct internal and external research to support solution definition 
Gain cross-functional alignment on solution development and deliverables 
Write user stories and define rough user interfaces to assist with development efforts 
Define requirements, scope, and acceptance criteria for features while operating within typical constraints (e.g., time, resources, etc.) with a focus on the end user 
Manage the solution lifecycle and backlog for various features based on customer needs and Soda Health’s strategic vision 
Serve as Soda Health’s subject matter expert (SME) in your area of ownership, and act as a key stakeholder for customer feedback, stakeholder questions and system troubleshooting 
Collaborate with Engineering teams during sprints to deliver solutions in an Agile manner 
Participate and sometimes lead solution rollout tasks, assisting with relevant testing and analytics functions 
 About You 

 While every candidate brings a unique resume and prospective, an ideal candidate will include: 

3-5 years of experience, ideally in a technology, healthcare, retail, and/or fintech setting 
Currently in the final year of a graduate program – preference for MBA, MPH, MHA, or MPP 
Must be able to make progress independently, including getting up to speed quickly, developing ideas, and creating clarity from ambiguity 
Strong problem-solving skills to overcome the challenges that come with creating something net new 
Detail-oriented and a strong communicator, including written deliverables and presentations 
Commitment to building a diverse culture that is highly collaborative, strives to set and achieve goals together, and embraces transparency, innovation, and accountability 
A clear passion for, if not experience in, addressing health inequities
cover_letter:
Benjamin Cooper  
January 29, 2025  

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my enthusiastic interest in the Spring 2025 Part-Time Graduate Intern position in Strategic Initiatives at Soda Health. With a Master's degree in Data Science in Biomedicine anticipated from UCLA and my professional experience as a Healthcare Data Analyst at Boston Children's Hospital, I am eager to contribute to Soda Health's mission of eliminating health inequities and creating a healthier America through innovative technology solutions.

During my recent role at Boston Children’s Hospital, I successfully led various data-driven initiatives aimed at promoting inclusivity and addressing health disparities. My work facilitated the capture of over $25 million through a state-run Medicaid program and supported comprehensive hospital-wide projects that align with my passion for reducing inefficiencies in healthcare systems. I possess a strong ability to conduct thorough research, analyze complex datasets, and develop strategic recommendations, skills which will be beneficial in supporting Soda Health's key organizational and go-to-market initiatives.

My experience extends to developing algorithms and predictive models—skills honed during my tenure as a Data Scientist with Cipher Skin, where I designed data structures for wearable technology. This technical foundation, coupled with a commitment to improving healthcare delivery through leveraging technology, aligns well with Soda Health’s cross-disciplinary approach. Furthermore, my academic background in both bioengineering and data science provides me with a unique perspective on the intersection of healthcare and technology, enabling me to tackle challenges from various angles.

I am particularly drawn to Soda Health's innovative culture and its dedication to creating sustained engagement and overall health improvement. As an advocate for health equity, I am excited about the opportunity to apply my analytical expertise and collaborative spirit to advance Soda Health’s strategic vision. I am confident that my skills in data visualization, problem-solving, and cross-functional collaboration will be an asset to your team.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the possibility of contributing to your team and supporting Soda Health’s mission.

Sincerely,  
Benjamin Cooper

job_description:
Data Analyst
Chicago, ILProduct and Technology – Data and informatics /Remote /Remote
About Synapticure
As a patient and caregiver-founded company, Synapticure provides instant access to expert neurologists, cutting-edge treatments and trials, and wraparound care coordination and behavioral health support in all 50 states through a virtual care platform. Partnering with providers and health plans, including CMS' new GUIDE dementia care model, Synapticure is dedicated to transforming the lives of millions of individuals and their families living with neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s and ALS.

The role
We are looking for a Data Analyst with 3-5 years of experience who is proficient in business intelligence and data visualization, particularly with Apache Superset or similar tools. The ideal candidate will be a SQL expert with a strong background in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industries. You should be a self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills, comfortable navigating ambiguity, and experienced in startup environments. Your ability to translate complex technical concepts to business stakeholders will be crucial in driving our data-driven strategies.

Job Duties – What you’ll be doing  
Data Analysis & Visualization:
-Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Apache Superset.
-Analyze complex datasets to provide actionable insights and support decision-making processes.

SQL Expertise:
-Write, optimize, and manage complex SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from various sources.
-Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing thorough data validation and cleaning.

Business Intelligence:
-Design and implement business intelligence solutions that align with organizational goals.
-Collaborate with stakeholders to identify data needs and translate them into effective reporting solutions.

Healthcare/Pharma Domain Knowledge:
-Apply your understanding of the healthcare and pharmaceutical industries to provide relevant insights and recommendations.
-Stay updated on industry trends and regulatory requirements to ensure compliance and relevance.

Problem Solving & Technical Communication:
-Address and resolve data-related issues and challenges with innovative solutions.
-Clearly communicate technical concepts and data insights to non-technical stakeholders to drive business outcomes.

Startup-Mindset & Continuous Learning:
-Embrace a startup mentality by being adaptable, resourceful, and proactive in a fast-paced environment.
-Continuously seek opportunities to learn and grow, staying current with industry best practices and emerging technologies.

Requirements - What we look for in you
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field; or equivalent experience.
3-5 years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on business intelligence and data visualization.
Proficiency with Apache Superset or similar BI tools.
Advanced SQL skills with the ability to write complex queries and optimize performance.
Experience in the healthcare or pharmaceutical sector is highly preferred.
Strong problem-solving abilities and a track record of successfully navigating ambiguous situations.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information to business stakeholders effectively.
Experience working in a startup environment or a dynamic, fast-paced setting.
A self-starter with a proactive approach to learning and professional development.
Our values
We’re founded by a patient and caregiver, and we’re a remote-first company. This means our values are at the heart of everything we do, and while we’re located all across the country, these principles are what tie us together around a common identity:
●  Relentless focus on patients and caregivers. We are determined to provide an exceptional experience for every patient we have the privilege to serve, and we put our patients first in everything we do.
●  Embody the spirit and humanity of those living with neurodegenerative disease. Inspired by our founders, families and personal experiences, we recognize the seriousness of our patients’ circumstances, and meet that challenge every day with empathy, compassion, kindness, joy, and most importantly – with hope.
●  Seek to understand, and stay curious. We start by listening to one another, our partners, our patients and their caregivers. We communicate with authenticity and humility, prioritizing honesty and directness while recognizing we always have something to learn. 
●  Embrace the opportunity. We are energized by the importance of our mission, and bias toward action.

job_description:
Data Scientist, Analytics Consulting
at Komodo Health (View all jobs)
United States
We Breathe Life Into Data

At Komodo Health, our mission is to reduce the global burden of disease. And we believe that smarter use of data is essential to this mission. That’s why we built the Healthcare Map — the industry’s largest, most complete, precise view of the U.S. healthcare system — by combining de-identified, real-world patient data with innovative algorithms and decades of clinical experience. The Healthcare Map serves as our foundation for a powerful suite of software applications, helping us answer healthcare’s most complex questions for our partners. Across the healthcare ecosystem, we’re helping our clients unlock critical insights to track detailed patient behaviors and treatment patterns, identify gaps in care, address unmet patient needs, and reduce the global burden of disease. 

As we pursue these goals, it remains essential to us that we stay grounded in our values: be awesome, seek growth, deliver “wow,” and enjoy the ride. At Komodo, you will be joining a team of ambitious, supportive Dragons with diverse backgrounds but a shared passion to deliver on our mission to reduce the burden of disease — and enjoy the journey along the way.

The Opportunity at Komodo Health

The Analytics Consulting team at Komodo Health specializes in providing advanced analytics solutions to healthcare organizations, leveraging real-world data to drive insights and decision-making.

Our data scientists build analytics pipelines/tables and complex logic for data projects that address customer needs.

Looking back on your first 12 months at Komodo Health, you will have…

Delivered high-value data analytics projects
Implemented client solutions using techniques like advanced statistical analysis or ML for targeted therapeutic areas in our patient population
Developed a deep understanding of healthcare claims data
Effectively partnered with teams to translate client requirements into analytics to solve client needs with the capabilities of datasets available at Komodo
Worked with the data science  team to scale our solutions, automate code, and centralize complex logic for reusability. Advocated for good engineering practices within the team
Presented findings, insights and analytical results to internal and external partners for client deliveries, as well as the larger DS function for continued growth and learning
What you bring to Komodo Health:

Analytical mindset and the ability to solve complex problems with limited supervision
At least three years of industry experience working with Python and large-scale databases using SQL (data query, data cleaning, data transformation)
Familiarity with PySpark and R
Experience working with a large anonymized patient level healthcare databases (preferably administrative claims or EHR)
Comfort communicating complex data science topics to audiences of variable technical capability
Proficient with complex topics in ML modeling, advanced statistics/biostatistics, algorithm design and knowledge of ML software packages
Ability to work well both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced and demanding agile environment
Interest in growing skills as a Data Scientist and being willing to learn and teach as part of a team
Strong business acumen demonstrated by a good understanding of how analytics insights (preferably in healthcare analytics) tie into business goals
High motivation, work ethic, and self-discipline to organize and complete tasks
cover_letter:
Benjamin Cooper  
January 29, 2025  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Data Scientist, Analytics Consulting position at Komodo Health. With a robust background in healthcare data analysis at Boston Children's Hospital and extensive experience in Python, SQL, and machine learning, I am thrilled about the opportunity to contribute my skills in advancing Komodo Health's mission to reduce the global burden of disease.

During my tenure as a Healthcare Data Analyst at Boston Children's Hospital, I worked directly with data from various electronic health records, crafting reports and visualizations that enabled data-driven decision-making across all hospital departments. My work facilitated significant initiatives, such as capturing over $25 million for state-run Medicaid programs, showcasing my ability to transform complex patient data into actionable insights. This experience aligns seamlessly with Komodo Health's goal of leveraging real-world data to drive insights and decision-making for healthcare partners.

I am particularly drawn to the opportunity at Komodo Health because of its commitment to using advanced analytics solutions to address critical questions within the healthcare ecosystem. My proficiency in Python and SQL, honed through my experience and ongoing education, including a Master's degree in Data Science in Biomedicine at UCLA, equips me to efficiently handle large-scale healthcare databases and implement machine learning techniques. My previous role as a Data Scientist at Cipher Skin included developing algorithms and data structures, as well as leading product testing sessions, highlighting my capability to deliver high-value data analytics projects and scale solutions for real-world applications.

Komodo Health’s values resonate with my professional ethos, and I am eager to immerse myself in the innovative and collaborative environment fostered by the Analytics Consulting team. I look forward to applying my strong analytical mindset, technical expertise, and passion for healthcare analytics to support Komodo Health's mission of delivering critical insights and reducing disease burdens worldwide.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss how my experience and skills align with the goals of Komodo Health.

Sincerely,  
Benjamin Cooper
