job_description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious mission: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

More than 1/3 of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet. 10% of greenhouse gas emissions come from food waste and loss.

Through our marketplace app, we connect businesses that have unsold, surplus food, with consumers who can buy and enjoy it at ⅓ of retail value. We are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste. Alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 111 million registered users and 237,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already saved 410 million meals from going to waste - avoiding almost 1.107,000 tonnes of CO2e!

Too Good To Go was named in FastCompany’s March 2022 list of the World's Most Innovative Companies, and was honoured to be included in TIME’s list of the 100 Most Influential Companies of 2022.

We’re looking for an exceptional Strategy & Planning Analyst to join the superstar team at Too Good To Go!

As a Strategy & Planning Analyst, you will manage high-priority cross-functional projects with strategic implications for the US business. Reporting to the Head of Strategy & Planning, you will work across departments to build reporting, analyze trends, facilitate discussions, and recommend and implement practices that boost performance.

The Role

Manage high-priority cross-functional projects, such as geographical expansion
Monitor marketplace health at the national and city level; surface areas for improvement and collaborate with relevant departments to drive the right actions
Synthesize quantitative and qualitative insights into concise, actionable recommendations that can be digested by leaders across the business
Ensure analytical and operational rigor in our reporting and processes
Support knowledge and best practice sharing and implementation among local and global stakeholders; drive adoption of team knowledge base to ensure key processes are documented and shared across the organization

We’re Looking For

Strong problem-solving skills; ability to provide insights and recommendations to support strategy development and execution
Strong data retrieval, analytics, data visualization, and presentation skills
Ability to build relationships internally and collaborate with local and global stakeholders across departments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
Proficient with Excel/Google Sheets and PowerPoint/Google Slides
Experience with Salesforce (reports, dashboards) and Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Looker) are a strong plus
A naturally curious, solution-oriented performer
Proactive go-getter who takes the initiative to streamline process and drive impact for the team

Our values

We Win Together
We Raise the Bar
We Keep It Simple
We Build A Legacy
We Care

What We Offer

A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you can see real and tangible impact in your role.
Working alongside an international community of users, partners and 1,350+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
Personal and professional development opportunities in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work
A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate successes and socialise with colleagues that care to offer 

Benefits

WORK FLEXIBLY: 
Enjoy hybrid working from our great offices, at home
Extra parental leave and days off beyond local legislation and the option to take an extra week of unpaid leave
100% Employer paid health coverage options for employee (Includes medical EPO plan, dental, and vision), and meaningful coverage options to suit your needs
Generous time off policies including 10 paid sick days, 5 paid wellness days, 20 paid vacation days, and 13 paid holidays per annum
Classpass, commuter benefits, Citibike or equivalent, and 401K
CELEBRATE & SOCIALISE
Regular social events 
Coffee, snacks and fully-equipped kitchens.
Paid volunteer time through our Shareback volunteering programme
Women in the Workplace, P.R.I.D.E., People of Colour and Functionally Diverse Employee Resource Groups
cover_letter:
Bennett Cooper  
January 30, 2025  

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Strategy & Planning Analyst position at Too Good To Go. With a background in strategic account management and data-driven analysis, combined with a strong passion for sustainability initiatives, I am eager to contribute to your mission to combat food waste and create a positive social impact.

My experience as a Partner Account Manager at Human Interest has honed my abilities in managing high-stakes projects and building strong relationships across diverse channels, including payroll, financial advisors, and benefit brokers. Managing over 40 partner accounts required excellent organizational skills and attention to detail—competencies I aim to leverage to ensure analytical and operational rigor at Too Good To Go. Additionally, my role at ADP, where I exceeded sales benchmarks and skillfully navigated complex negotiations, reinforced my capability to synthesize data into actionable strategies that enhance performance. These experiences have cultivated a proactive, solution-oriented mindset, aligning with your values of winning together and raising the bar.

The environmental initiatives at Too Good To Go resonate with my academic background—having graduated with a BA in Political Science and a minor in Environment & Society from Syracuse University. During my internship with the Environmental Protection Agency, I presented research on vital environmental sites and crafted media monitoring reports, sharpening my skills in data retrieval and analytical reporting. This foundation is crucial for monitoring marketplace health and driving growth strategies in your scale-up environment.

Beyond technical skills, my interpersonal and communication strengths are evidenced by my success in securing over 100 contributions as a Student Caller at Syracuse University and organizing large-scale events in leadership roles. I am eager to bring this ability to build and maintain relationships to your global team, ensuring effective collaboration with local and international stakeholders.

Thank you for considering my application. I am excited about the opportunity to join an innovative and influential company like Too Good To Go and to contribute meaningfully to your mission. I look forward to potentially discussing how I can add value to your strategy and planning endeavors.

Sincerely,  
Bennett Cooper

job_description:
ABOUT BERLINROSEN

BerlinRosen is a fast-growing, full-service consulting and communications firm with more than 300 communications and campaign strategists in New York, Washington, D.C. and Los Angeles. Since its founding in 2005, BerlinRosen has powerfully expanded its presence in corporate, social impact/ESG, nonprofit, entertainment, media, racial justice, healthcare, hospitality, real estate, architecture, design, urbanism, land use, lifestyle, technology, issue advocacy and workers’ rights communications. They have received more than 50 awards and recognitions, including being the only agency to be named #1 on Observer’s PR Power List for three consecutive years, PRNews’ Large PR Agency of the Year (2023; 2021), PR News’ Digital Firm of the Year (2023) and 5/5 Stars on Forbes’ latest Best PR Agencies in America list.

People of color, people with disabilities and women are strongly encouraged to apply. BerlinRosen is committed to building and maintaining a diverse staff, and recognizes that its continued success depends on hiring and retaining high-quality creative professionals with a variety of backgrounds and experiences. Opportunities for advancement exist, and we are committed to helping all staff develop and grow.

 

ABOUT THE CITIES & PUBLIC AFFAIRS TEAM

BerlinRosen’s Cities practice comprises over 70 communications professionals who bring a unique campaign-style approach to strategic communications. We work with visionary clients in New York, Los Angeles and other major cities across the country on issues ranging from healthcare, urban planning, affordable housing, issue advocacy, social impact and progressive policy, public affairs, higher education, real estate, travel, lifestyle, arts & culture and more. Whether it’s winning community and political support, policy change, elevating new projects and brands or launching some of our city's most visited attractions, we help our clients shape the future of cities.

The Public Affairs team within the Cities practice works with thought leaders, award-winning institutions and major advocacy groups, including the New York Immigration Coalition, the New York Housing Conference, the Citizens Budget Commission and the Regional Plan Association.

 

ABOUT THIS ROLE

BerlinRosen is seeking an Account Coordinator to join our team working on public affairs. This role will focus on supporting a variety of strategic communications plans by owning media relations, project management and writing tasks. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about issues that cities face, both in New York and across the country—including land use and urban planning, social issues, housing, sustainability, economic development and health care. The person best suited for this role will have excellent writing and organizational skills, plus internship or other relevant experience in strategic communications, journalism, political campaigns or government.

Role location: This role is based in our New York, N.Y. office on a hybrid basis. The Cities team is in-office 3 days per week.

 

ACCOUNTABILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

As an Account Coordinator on the Cities & Public Affairs team, you will…

Implement strategy, creative brainstorming and campaign planning for multiple high-profile accounts
Pitch and place media stories across local, regional and national outlets; build and maintain press lists
Write and edit persuasive external and internal documents such as client emails, press releases, fact sheets, talking points, media pitches and communications plans
Oversee day-to-day communications with clients, including staffing weekly calls, developing meeting agendas, press coverage and event recaps and participate in events
Manage work streams across multiple accounts
Assist in the execution of a variety of public affairs tactics, including stakeholder engagement, in-person and digital grassroots organizing and paid advertising
Support teams at client media events
Essential skills: 

Internship or other relevant experience in strategic communications from working in politics, government or advocacy or with a PR agency, media outlet or in-house communications team
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing
Ability to handle multiple assignments at once, work quickly and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability to work with a team to meet group objectives

I am writing to express my enthusiastic interest in the Account Coordinator position with BerlinRosen's Cities & Public Affairs Team. With a background in public affairs, strategic communications, and a deep dedication to urban planning and social issues, I am eager to contribute to your team and help shape the future of cities across the country. BerlinRosen’s commitment to impactful communication, coupled with its dedication to diverse and inclusive practices, aligns perfectly with my professional goals and personal values.

During my time as a Public Affairs Intern at the Environmental Protection Agency, I honed my skills in media monitoring and communications strategy while working on significant projects like the Onondaga Lake Superfund Site. This experience fortified my understanding of complex environmental and urban issues and equipped me with the ability to compose compelling narratives and detailed reports. My role also involved daily creation of media monitoring reports, a task that sharpened my attention to detail and organizational skills—both crucial for success in a fast-paced environment like BerlinRosen.

In my most recent role as a Partner Account Manager at Human Interest, I managed over 40 partner accounts, where I demonstrated my ability to communicate clearly and effectively with diverse stakeholders. My experience in account management taught me the value of precision and clarity in communication, essential traits for managing multiple assignments and meeting tight deadlines. These skills will be directly applicable in your workspace, where strategic, creative thinking, and multitasking are essential to advancing client goals.

I am particularly excited about the opportunity to work on public affairs initiatives that advance social impact and progressive policy. My academic background in Political Science, coupled with my practical experience in advocacy and strategic communications, has prepared me to make a significant contribution to BerlinRosen. I am eager to bring my skills and passion for public affairs to your team and work collaboratively to achieve ambitious objectives.

I look forward to the possibility of discussing how I can contribute to your team’s success. Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,  
Bennett Cooper

focus_areas: server, hard worker
job_description:
Job Summary
We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Server to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for providing exceptional customer service in a fast-paced dining environment. As a Server, you will play a crucial role in ensuring that our guests have an enjoyable dining experience by delivering food and beverages promptly and accurately while maintaining high standards of food safety and hospitality.

Duties

Greet and seat guests in a friendly and welcoming manner.
Take accurate food and beverage orders using the POS system.
Provide detailed information about menu items, including ingredients and preparation methods.
Assist with food preparation and ensure proper food handling techniques are followed.
Serve food and drinks to guests in a timely manner while ensuring their needs are met throughout their dining experience.
Handle cash register transactions accurately, including processing payments and providing change.
Maintain cleanliness of the dining area, including tables, chairs, and service stations.
Collaborate with kitchen staff to ensure timely delivery of orders and address any customer concerns promptly.
Uphold high standards of food safety and sanitation practices at all times.
Qualifications

Previous experience in a customer service role, preferably in the hospitality or culinary industry.
Knowledge of food safety practices and proper food handling techniques.
Familiarity with POS systems and cash register operations is preferred.
Strong communication skills with the ability to work well in a team-oriented environment.
Ability to multitask effectively while maintaining attention to detail.
A positive attitude with a commitment to providing excellent service to guests.
Flexibility to work various shifts, including evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.
Join us in creating memorable dining experiences for our guests!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.30 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 25 per week

Shift:

Day shift
Evening shift
Morning shift
cover_letter:
Jacob Zucker

Dear Hiring Manager,  

I am writing to express my interest in the Server position advertised. With a background in providing exceptional service in team settings, including volunteer work and camp leadership roles, I am enthusiastic about the opportunity to bring my skills to your dynamic team and contribute to creating memorable dining experiences for your guests.

My experience at Camp Alonim has honed my ability to work efficiently in fast-paced environments while maintaining a keen focus on customer service and safety. As a Nature Program Specialist and Day Camp Counselor, I developed activity plans that prioritized both enjoyment and well-being, skills that are crucial in a dining environment where customer satisfaction and food safety are paramount.

In my volunteer role with the DESK Food Pantry, I engaged directly with clients, handling inquiries and ensuring an organized and welcoming service experience. This role required strong communication and organizational skills, both of which I believe will serve me well as a Server. Additionally, my familiarity with handling transactions and attention to detail will enable me to manage POS system operations and cash register transactions accurately.

I am particularly drawn to the opportunity to work in a team-oriented environment and am excited about the possibility of contributing to a positive and efficient service atmosphere. My adaptability and commitment to exceptional service align well with the qualifications you are seeking, and I am eager to bring my positive attitude and strong work ethic to your establishment.

Thank you for considering my application. I am looking forward to the possibility of contributing to your team and ensuring guests enjoy an outstanding dining experience.
